title: Teamledare digital service till stadsledningskontoret
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Stadsledningskontoret är kommunstyrelsens förvaltning. Vi ansvarar för styrning, uppföljning och utveckling av stadens verksamheter utifrån den vision och budget som kommunfullmäktige har beslutat om. Vi är drygt 300 anställda som i huvudsak arbetar med strategiska frågor som har stor betydelse för stadens verksamheter.
   

  

 Stockholms stads strategiska it-verksamhet leds och styrs av stadsledningskontorets avdelning för it och digitalisering. Vårt uppdrag är att skapa förutsättningar för morgondagens digitalisering bland annat genom att förvalta och utveckla stadens centrala it-miljö. Nu satsar Stockholms stad på att utveckla vår digitala service till Stockholmarna. Vill du i rollen som teamledare bidra till den utvecklingen? Skicka in din ansökan senast den 16/2!
   

  

**Välkommen till oss**
 På avdelningen för it och digitalisering ingår enheten Strategi och styrning. Vår enhet består av 12 engagerade medarbetare och vi sitter i fina och ljusa lokaler på Kungsholmen. Vi samordnar, styr och stödjer stadens digitaliseringsarbete. Vi ansvarar för Stockholms stads stadsövergripande styrdokument och styrmodeller inom it-området. Under åren 2025-2027 utökas vår enhet med ett team som ska utveckla stadens digitala service med målsättning att etablera långsiktigt hållbara arbetssätt. Detta utökade team behöver en kommunikativ och strukturerad teamledare.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* en kreativ arbetsplats där kompetens och samarbete är en viktig grund för arbetsglädje och goda resultat,
* goda kompetensutvecklingsmöjligheter,
* stort nätverk inom Stockholms stad med många samarbetsytor,
* stora möjligheter till att bidra till samhällsnytta,
* flexibel arbetstid, friskvårdsbidrag och träningslokaler i nära anslutning till arbetsplatsen.


**Din roll**
 Som teamledare blir du enhetschefens förlängda arm i arbetet med att leda och driva ett centralt team med stort strategiskt ansvar. Teamet består av ca 5 seniora generalister och experter som är utvalda att tillsammans utveckla stadsledningskontorets förmåga att samordna, leda och styra utvecklingen av stadens digitala service till Stockholmarna. Teamet kommer även kompletteras med konsulter och praktikanter utifrån behov.
   

  

 I rollen ingår att:
   

  

* Tillsammans med enhetschef ta ansvar för den långsiktiga strategiska riktningen och målsättningen
* Koordinera det agila arbetet i teamet och säkerställa framdrift
* Skapa struktur och förutsättningar för arbetet
* Säkerställa en god administration, dokumentation och löpande budgethållning


**Din kompetens och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleexamen eller motsvarande utbildning och yrkeserfarenhet
* Aktuell och flerårig erfarenhet av att leda team med experter och seniora medarbetare
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, exempelvis scrum
* Förståelse för webb- och tjänsteutveckling
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning och förändringskommunikation
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en stor, komplex organisation


 Vi tror att du även:
   

  

* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med användbarhet och kundresor
* Lockas av att vara med och driva en utforskande förändringsresa där målen finns men planen inte är satt i sten


 För att lyckas i rollen som teamledare behöver du vara ansvarstagande och van att leda andra. Du trivs med att ha experter och seniora medarbetare i ditt team. Du strukturerar och driver självständigt ditt arbete framåt och har förståelse för och vana att hantera komplexa frågor. Du ser helheter, har ett brett perspektiv på frågor och förstår den långsiktiga betydelsen och vidare konsekvenser av beslut och anpassar dina handlingar till detta. Det är också av stor vikt att du har ett öppet och samarbetsvilligt förhållningssätt där du bjuder in till dialog. Du anpassar din kommunikation och ditt sätt att förmedla budskap efter mottagare och har förståelse för hur kommunikation driver förändring.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Vi rekryterar utan det personliga brevet för att stärka fokus på de kompetenser och erfarenheter som efterfrågas för denna roll. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan kommer vi att utgå ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor du får besvara i samband med att du söker tjänsten. Det kommer även att ingå tester som en del i bedömningen i samband med urvalet.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen kommer sedan bestå av intervjuer och referenstagning.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/413 | Kontakt: Michaela Kalén, rekryteringskonsult 08-50811727, Kristina Lundevall, rekryterande chef 08-50829524, | Facklig företrädare: Katina Staf, Vision 08-50829192, Andreas Meschke, SACO 08-50829589, | Publicerat: 2025-02-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-16

title: Customer Success Manager - Private Sector
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in business-critical areas such as ESG (Environmental, Social & Governance), GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance), Strategic and Quality work. Unlike other compliance tools, we go a step further by moving organizations from reporting to action and effectively distributing responsibility internally.
 



 We’re looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work with private-sector clients, focusing on those with products in GRC and ESG. You’ll manage a wide range of customer relationships and help clients navigate regulatory frameworks like CSRD, NIS2 & DORA while driving value through our platform.
 



 As a Customer Success Manager, you’ll focus on both our customers and our platform. You’ll be the main contact for small and large clients and take overall responsibility for their success. This role is all about combining platform knowledge with relationship building, so we’re looking for someone who enjoys working directly with our platform, staying close to customers, and driving growth. A data-driven approach will help you find ways to improve and create strategic solutions that bring real value to our clients.
 



  





 WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡
 


* An engaging work environment with people with a shared mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Opportunities to learn about GRC, ESG, and the financial sector, even if you don’t have prior experience.
* Challenging, varied, and engaging work tasks with room and encouragement to be independent and innovative.
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Please look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office in one of Hötorgsskraporna in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 You’ll have a strategic impact by guiding clients from adoption to expansion—a key factor in our growth. Working closely with Project Managers and Sales Specialists, you’ll ensure clients fully utilize the platform, strengthening loyalty and opening doors for further sales.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Build long-term customer relationships based on trust and engagement, working with both senior decision-makers and operational teams.
* Ensure customers achieve their goals and get full value from our platform.
* Assist customers with platform adjustments and improvements.
* Advise customers, raising awareness and interest in our products.
* Develop deep product knowledge to become a trusted advisor for customers.
* Sales responsibility: Collaborate with Sales Specialists to proactively manage sales activities, meet revenue targets, and identify new opportunities within existing accounts.
* Manage personal responsibilities with an individual budget, including a clear sales and budget responsibility.
* Handle negotiations, renewals, and agreements with clients.
* Work with Sales Specialists to analyze product usage, identify growth opportunities, and optimize product utilization.



  





 YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️
 


* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field, such as business administration or systems science.
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience, preferably as a Customer Success Manager.
* Experience working with negotiations and customer agreements.
* Strong interest in systems and digitization with experience in handling and learning new systems.
* Fluent in Swedish with excellent English skills.



  





 Bonus Qualifications:
 


* Understanding of regulatory requirements for industries like banking and finance.
* Experience with GRC, ESG, or CSRD-related processes.
* Tech-savvy and eager to learn more about technical solutions.



  





**About You 👀** 




 To thrive in the role, we see that you are a relationship-builder with a genuine interest in customer-oriented work and smart digital solutions. You are self-motivated, proactive, and have a positive attitude. You are curious and eager to learn, embracing new developments in the ever-evolving tech landscape. You value a positive team environment and the opportunity to be part of a growth journey. You are simply ready for your next adventure with Stratsys!
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate—show your interest today since we are working ongoing with the selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you? Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 Want to read more about us and your future colleagues or take part in our everyday life? Visit jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Solution Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a BRM Lead/Solution Architect to join our ISG – CMT practice Team.
   

  

**About Cognizant ISG-CMT**
 ISG-CMT is Cognizant’s Industry Solutions Group vertical focused on Communications, Media and Technology markets with core IT solutions implementations and consulting. Part of Communications service line, we work with the world’s leading Telecommunications clients in providing end to end managed services including digital transformation programs implementations using the market leading Telecomm BSS/OSS COTS applications.
   

  

*More information? Please visit* 
*https://www.cognizant.com/consulting*
**About The Role**
*As
 **BRM Lead / Solution Architect** 
 you are expected to have experience ranging from 12 to 18 years of implementation projects using Oracle BRM, PDC Applications working with clients, implementing, transforming and migrating their legacy BSS applications to modern Digital BSS solutions. Carry experience of Cloud Native Oracle BRM implementation. Lead requirements gathering workshops with Customer SMEs and Stakeholders, document requirements, conduct POCs and design solutions, and have proven ability to extend applications with customization requirements in Oracle BRM along with the skills of implementing PDC pricing and tariff configurations for the Mobile and Fixed line service offerings of Telecom Billing.*
**Our ideal candidate**
* 12 – 18 years of Oracle BRM consulting and implementation projects experience.
* Experience driving customer requirements workshops, design solutions using Oracle BRM and PDC.
* Experience developing BRM customizations, OPCODES and integrations.
* Excellent communication skills and team player.
* Preferably have Implementation Certification in BRM 7 or later versions.


**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a the ‘flag ship’ success story and journey of Digital BSS transformation - We go through enormous growth!
* Based in the Stockholm – we have offices in Amsterdam, Eindhoven and Brussels within an European and Global network
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conform benefits


**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant is one of the world’s leading professional services companies, transforming clients’ business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 205 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.

title: Infrastructure Architect, Management Access- Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Infrastructure Architect specializing in Access Management to join our Dynamic Unified Management Access team. The successful candidate will be hands-on responsible for designing, implementing, and managing Management Access solutions to secure and protect sensitive information and access. You will work closely with various stakeholders to ensure that our infrastructure is usable, robust, secure, and compliant with various industry standards.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Tech Services as an Infrastructure architect, you will:**
* Evaluate existing network infrastructure and recommend improvements or enhancements.
* Design, implement and maintain Management Solution to meet the security needs of the organization.
* Collaborate with the company customer teams, solution, security and compliance teams to establish and maintain network policies and procedures.
* Enable the deployment and integration of tools and technologies.
* Monitor the effectiveness of Management Access controls and make necessary adjustments to improve security posture and other capabilities.
* Provide expert guidance and support for the resolution of complex network security issues.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and developments in network technology development and broader cybersecurity practices.


**We believe you have:**
* A solid understanding of network topologies, and strong skills in designing, planning, and operational configuration to manage complex network structures efficiently.
* 5+ years of experience in IT architecture including designing and deploying Management solutions in an enterprise environment.
* Strong experience in network word and expertise in networking products especially experience with Juniper products is a plus
* Experience with platform management with HCI products like VMware, SimpliVity and Hypervisors like VMware and Hyper-V, Nutanix AHV
* Experience in license management and Active Directory (AD) environments
* This role requires Swedish citizenship and security clearance will be done on final candidate.


- 

**We also believe you have:**
* A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related.
* Certifications in networking and above-mentioned technologies is a plus
* Understanding of cybersecurity principles, standards, and best practices.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively across teams.


**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Jarkko Kentala jarkko.kentala@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Stockholm/Örebro/Malmö (Hybrid)
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Operations Support Agent Arlanda
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Operation Support Agents.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Ensuring that customers' urgent packages get to the right place, on time
* Answering incoming calls from customers in relation to shipment collection requests and delivery inquiries
* Checking and investigating failed shipments deliveries or collections when needed; prioritising and reallocating any failed deliveries for the next day delivery
* Entering data into our in-house tracking system
* Running clear and effective communication and collaboration with the team, your manager, and other operations stations
* Adhering to FedEx processes, procedures and controls, and regulatory requirements


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Good communication and social skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with strict timelines
* Ability to manage own time effectively with attention to detail


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Senior Data Engineer to ICA Banken
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
*ICA Banken have embarked on a digital transformation journey and are investing in establishing a data platform based on Data Mesh principles on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). We are therefore looking for passionate Data Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of our data ecosystem.*
**This is your job:**
 Welcome to a high-performing team that will have a fundamental impact on ICA Banken’s journey to becoming a data-driven organisation. We are part of the Data & Analytics department in Solna and work on the establishment of a data platform on GCP, which is our new target architecture. The strategy is to move data from our source systems to GCP and develop data products to strengthen the organisation from both the business and technology sides.
   

  

 As our Senior Data Engineer, you will be a bridge between business and IT, collaborating closely with both sides. Your focus is on designing a futuristic data platform on GCP, aligned with Data Mesh principles, to significantly enhance data accessibility, scalability, and innovation across the organization. Furthermore, you would be designing and optimizing data pipelines to ensure seamless integration and processing across diverse data sources and designing data models with best practices in schema design, data partitioning and indexing to improve performance and efficiency. You will work closely with stakeholders to implement various business use cases using tools like DBT, and together with data engineers, scientists, architects, and business stakeholders you will deliver value-driven data solutions.
   

  

 Moreover, you will be enforcing security standards to protect sensitive banking data throughout its lifecycle.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to come in at the beginning and help us build up a data platform of the future- the ground is set and now it’s all about development!
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for you who have a university degree in engineering, programing or similar and at least 5 years of experience in data engineering or related roles. We assume you have knowledge of data product thinking and data modeling design and query optimization strategies.
   

  

 To thrive in this position, you need experience from working within a cloud data platform and their data services. You are passionate about creating value from data and supporting the organisation becoming data driven. Experience applying data governance frameworks that ensure data integrity and quality is considered a plus.
   

  

 To be eligible for this position, you should be fluent in spoken and written English and Swedish is a merit.
   

  

 As a person, you are analytical, structured, goal-oriented, passionate about data and driving positive change in the organization. You are equally comfortable talking to technical experts as you are with those who have never worked with data. You thrive in a collaborative and agile environment.
   

  

**What happens next?**
 The deadline for applications is February 9th , but we are continuously reviewing applications, so send it in as soon as possible!
   

  

**Contact:**
 Questions about the position can be answered by the recruiter responsible, Bojana Mijocevic, tel. 076 695 15 33, and the hiring manager, Jakob Tardelius Hemborg 070-262 23 86
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.
   

  

 Are you curious about us and want to become one of our new colleagues? Of course, you are! Welcome with your application!

title: Teknisk projektledare
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Consulting
description:
Är IT-branschen och projektledning din hemmaplan? Ser du kombinationen av att driva kundprojekt och att själv få vara med och bygga lösningarna som det bästa av två världar? Då kan detta vara nästa stora steg i din karriär! Varmt välkommen till Lime!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Som teknisk projektledare ansvarar du för att driva kundprojekt som tar våra kunder till nya höjder. Du ansvarar för hela implementationsprocessen och att löpande stötta kunden under processens gång så att de får ut det mesta av sin CRM-investering.
   

  

 Mer konkret handlar det om att:
   

  

* Hålla möten och workshops för att identifiera och kravställa kundens behov
* Planera projekten och sköta dialog med eventuella tredjeparter
* Säkra projektleverans och utbilda slutanvändare
* Konfigurera och skräddarsy den tekniska kundlösningen tillsammans med Limes applikationsutvecklare


 För att lyckas krävs det att du arbetar strukturerat och målfokuserat samt är van vid att leda projekt med kunden i fokus. Projektens storlek kan variera mellan 2–18 månader och du kommer att arbeta parallellt med såväl nya projekt som långsiktiga förvaltningsprojekt med några av våra större kunder. Att bygga relation med kunderna är på så vis en central del av rollen.
   

  

 När du inte är ute på kundbesök utgår du från ett av våra Limekontor och blir en del av vår Expert Services-avdelning. Du får totalt 500 härliga kollegor runt om i Europa, varav cirka 175 tillhör Expert Services.
   

  

 Detta är en konsultroll där du kommer att jobba mot en uppsatt budget samt individuella debiteringsmål. En del av din lön (cirka 15-20%) kommer att vara rörlig och baseras på din debiteringsgrad.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vem är du?**
* Du har 2-4 års erfarenhet av att projektleda mjukvaruimplementationer
* Du har ett affärstänk och en generell verksamhetsförståelse
* Du tar ägandeskap i dialog med kund och är van vid att jobba med flera olika intressenter och stakeholders
* Du kan omvandla problem, processer och behov till kreativa lösningar och konkreta förslag
* Du har en akademisk utbildning, helst inom IT
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat
* Du har körkort


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime!
   

  

 Vi firar framgång och när vi når våra mål bjuder vi med alla kollegor på en stor sommarfest. Vi har utöver det en årlig julfest, frukost varje måndag, daglig trefika med gofika på fredagar samt wellness- och aktivitetsgrupper på respektive kontor som anordnar gemensamma aktiviteter. Vi tycker om att umgås med varandra – att ha kul och att prestera går hos oss hand i hand!
   

  

 Förutom allt detta erbjuder vi kollektivavtal, sex veckors semester, friskvårdsbidrag, pension samt stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

**Processen?**
 Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi driver rekryteringsprocessen kontinuerligt tills vi hittat den där handen-i-handsken-matchningen. I första steget screenar vi på din ansökan. Därefter följer intervjuer, ett praktiskt case samt referenstagning. Vår process avslutas alltid med slutintervju med vår VD Nils.

title: Head of Growth
description:
**About us:** 




 Hormona is a data-driven women’s health company, on a mission to revolutionize women’s health. Our award-winning app is the first comprehensive personalized hormone tracking app that helps women of all ages understand and optimize their individual cycle and hormone health. Through a wide range of popular features such as hormone, cycle, period, and symptom tracking, daily health insights, hormone education, dietary advice, and symptom-mitigating tips and plans, Hormona is pioneering the area of "Hormone Health" and cycle optimization.
 



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 




 We are looking for a results-oriented, fast-moving individual to drive growth at Hormona. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, creative problem-solving skills, and a deep understanding of data and how to scale a digital product. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing both high-level strategy and hands-on execution.
 



 You’re not afraid to experiment, test, and iterate until you find the best path forward. Whether it’s designing innovative growth campaigns, refining user acquisition funnels, or optimizing conversion rates, you bring a relentless focus on performance and scalability and you’re able to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams to achieve ambitious goals.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As the Head of Growth, you will lead the strategy and execution of Hormona’s growth initiatives. You’ll take ownership of the full user lifecycle—from acquisition to retention and monetization—ensuring that every step of the user journey is optimized for maximum impact.
 



 You will be responsible for driving scalable growth by leveraging data to identify opportunities, design experiments, and implement strategies that deliver measurable results. Working closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and engineering, you’ll ensure alignment across growth efforts to drive engagement, conversions, and overall business growth.
 



 This is a unique opportunity to lead growth for a fast-growing health tech company and make a real difference in the lives of millions of women worldwide.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Develop and Execute Growth Strategy** 
 : Design and implement a comprehensive growth strategy that drives accelerated user acquisition, retention, and revenue growth.
* **User Acquisition** 
 : Lead paid and organic acquisition strategies, identifying and optimizing key channels (e.g., paid media, SEO, partnerships, referrals) to grow the user base effectively.
* **Conversion Rate Optimization** 
 : Own and optimize the onboarding, engagement, and upgrade funnels to convert free users to paid subscribers.
* **Data-Driven Growth** 
 : Analyze user behavior, market trends, and performance metrics to identify opportunities and inform decisions. Use A/B testing and experiments to validate hypotheses and improve performance.
* **Retention and Engagement** 
 : Develop strategies to improve user retention and increase LTV by creating personalized and engaging experiences for users.
* **Collaborate Across Teams** 
 : Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure seamless integration of growth initiatives into the overall user experience.
* **Growth Experimentation** 
 : Design, execute, and analyze experiments to test new growth ideas, optimize campaigns, and iterate on successful tactics.
* **User Insights** 
 : Gather insights through data analysis, surveys, and focus groups to better understand user needs, pain points, and motivations.
* **Marketing Alignment** 
 : Partner with the marketing team to align campaigns, promotions, and messaging to drive user acquisition and retention.
* **Performance Metrics** 
 : Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of growth efforts and report findings to stakeholders.
* **Scaling Growth** 
 : Build scalable systems and processes that support sustainable growth across all user touchpoints.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Proven experience (5+ years) in growth, marketing, or a related field, ideally within the health, wellness, or subscription app industry.
* Strong understanding of data, user acquisition, retention, and monetization strategies, particularly in freemium or subscription-based business models.
* Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, RevenueCat) and growth experimentation platforms.
* Experience in designing and running A/B tests, growth experiments, and performance campaigns.
* Hands-on experience with paid media platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Ads) and SEO strategies.
* A track record of driving measurable growth through innovative and scalable strategies.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a willingness to roll up your sleeves and execute.
* A data-driven approach to problem-solving and decision-making.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Experience with mobile app growth strategies, particularly in health or wellness industries.
* Knowledge of subscription-based or SaaS business models and revenue optimization.
* Familiarity with women’s health trends, challenges, and opportunities in digital health.
* Advanced degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field is a plus.



  





**What we offer you** 




 😊 A friendly, curious, and international working environment with a small, ambitious team
 



 ⏰ Flexible working opportunities
 



 🤝 Impact the future of the company
 



 💼 Office space at Norrsken in Stockholm
 



 🌎 Fun meet-ups with the whole team around Europe
 



 ⭐️ Play a big role in our mission to improve the future of female health
 



 🌱 Growth opportunities
 



 💰 Competitive salary with the opportunity for options
 



  





 As the Head of Growth, you’ll have the unique opportunity to lead the expansion of Hormona’s platform, driving measurable results that impact both the business and the lives of millions of women. Join us and help transform women’s health through data-driven innovation and growth.

title: ServiceNow GRC konsult
description:
*Är du en skicklig och ambitiös konsult med erfarenhet av risk- och säkerhetshantering? Har du en passion för teknik och vill hjälpa till att leverera innovativa lösningar via ServiceNow-plattformen? Då vill vi att du ska bli en del av teamet!* 




 \_ \_ \_ \_
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Risk & Compliance Consulting (RCC) på KPMG Advisory är ett mångsidigt team på cirka 60 kollegor med ämnes expertis inom risktransformation, regelefterlevnad, forensiska utredningar och hantering av bedrägeririsker, intern kontroll, riskhantering, internrevision och hållbarhet. Vi arbetar med ett brett spektrum av riskrådgivningstjänster och våra medarbetare har mycket olika bakgrunder, inklusive ekonomi, juridik, teknik, företagsekonomi och statsvetenskap.
 



 Vår mångfald i både människor och kompetenser gör oss till en ledande rådgivare på marknaden. Vi arbetar med högpresterande kunder inom alla sektorer, inklusive privat sektor, offentlig sektor och finansiella tjänster. En viktig del av vårt arbete är digitalisering och integrering av ny teknik för att förändra riskhanterings- och efterlevnadsprocesser för våra kunder. Vi ger råd till våra kunder i deras transformationsresor och främjar digitala, innovativa och hållbara lösningar på våra kunders affärsutmaningar.
 



  





 Vi hjälper våra kunder med rådgivning och implementering av den ledande teknikplattformen ServiceNow, för digitalisering och transformation inom våra discipliner. Våra verksamhetsområden inkluderar riskhantering, säkerhet, supply chain, HR, portföljhantering, leverantörsstyrning och utveckling av kundspecifika lösningar.
 



  





 KPMGs ServiceNow satsning är en global framgångssaga och vårt fokus på professionell expertis och domänexpertis har gjort oss till en föredragen partner, både för ServiceNow och för våra kunder. Våra insatser har uppmärksammats globalt genom att bland annat ha utsetts till ServiceNow Global Transformation Partner of the Year 2023.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Vi söker dig som har, eller vill bygga, kompetens inom riskhantering, cybersäkerhet, regelefterlevnad, bolagsstyrning samt krisberedskap och integritet – ur ett teknik- och verktygsstödsperspektiv. Det finns mycket utrymme att växa professionellt och personligt i denna position!
 



  





 Som ServiceNow GRC konsult kommer du att;
 


* Spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att stärka sin GRC-funktion (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) med hjälp av ServiceNow plattformen
* Vara involverad i olika kundengagemang inom olika branscher
* Vägleda och hjälpa kunder med råd om implementering och användning av ServiceNow inom primärt Governance Risk and Compliance
* Bidra till att utforma och anpassa lösningar som adresserar kundens behov inom risk- och säkerhetshantering, regelefterlevnad, leverantörsrisk, nödberedskap och integritet
* Samarbeta med multidisciplinära team för att säkerställa leveranser av hög kvalitet
* Vara en drivande kraft för bästa praxis och ständiga förbättringar
* Aktivt delta i utvecklingen av tjänsteområdet inom ServiceNow med innovativa lösningar på komplexa problem, och inte minst hjälpa till att bygga ett starkt cyber- och GRC-community i hela Norden och EMA



 ,
 



**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Masterexamen inom teknik, ekonomi, IT-säkerhet, samhällssäkerhet och riskhantering eller motsvarande
* 2-6 års erfarenhet inom relevanta områden som risk- och säkerhetshantering, IT-styrning eller compliance
* Praktisk erfarenhet av GRC-verktyg, särskilt ServiceNow
* God teknisk förståelse och intresse för hur teknik kan stödja affärsprocesser
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska



  





**Vill du göra skillnad med oss?** 




  





 Vänta inte med din ansökan eftersom vi granskar ansökningar och anställer löpande. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten, tveka inte att kontakta rekryterande chef Emil Lundvall, emil.lundvall@kpmg.se. För eventuella frågor relaterade till rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner, Susanne Hedberg, susanne.hedberg@kpmg.se
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och för nya kollegor att haka på vår resa!** 




  





 I den här rekryteringen har vi följande steg;
 


* Verksamhetsintervju
* Personlighet- och logisk test med personlighetsintervju
* Slutintervju
* Referenser
* Bakgrundskontroll

title: Operations Manager
description:
Join our dynamic and international team at Sherwin-Williams, where we are committed to excellence in production and operations of surface coatings As an
 **Operations Manager,** 
 you will play a crucial role in ensuring the highest standards of safety, quality, and efficiency at our production site, with a total of 70 employees. You will be responsible for ensuring safe systems of work, providing a safe working environment. You will lead your management team to enable an efficient production that meet customer requirements, promote a culture of continuous improvement, and support the managers in leading their teams effectively. You work locally with your management team as well as with regional resources in EMEAI and also the US.
 



 This work is site-based at our production site in Arlandastad. You will be managing a team of five direct reports – Production Supervision, Planning, and Plant Quality Management. You will be reporting to our Area Manager of Operations.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Ensure a supportive leadership culture that develops and strengthens the direct reports
* Enforce safe systems of work and hold team members accountable for health and safety performance.
* Strive for zero recordable injuries by ensuring compliance with internal policies and external legislation
* Ensure a quality culture and that quality standards are met.
* Ensure that continuous improvement is a natural part of the daily work at all levels
* Collect and analyze performance data to improve manufacturing, filling, and packaging efficiencies
* Reduce waste and ensure accurate stock management.
* Prepare reports, KPI’s and participate in management meetings.



  





**Who are you?** 




 As a person, you are hands on and have experience of managing others, preferably a team of five. You thrive in a leadership role, with a string sense of responsibility and genuine passion for coaching your team to be the best version of themselves. You are proactive, solution-oriented, and skilled at building trust within you team and across different functions within the organization. Your ability to handle challenges with a positive attitude makes you an excellent fit for this role.
 



 What experiences do you bring?
 


* Degree or relevant experience of 10+ years in a related field. Preferably within Supply Chain/Operations.
* Excellent interpersonal, coaching, and negotiating skills.
* Proven track record in managing change within a diverse environment.
* Documented knowledge and experience of running continuous improvement work and tools in improvement methodology, LEAN or similar.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Strong ability to analyze data and drive appropriate actions.
* Proficient in producing and presenting proposals with strong analytical skills and business acumen.
* Good computer skills, including strong Excel skills and MS Office.



  





**We Are Sherwin-Williams** 




 Our mission began more than 150 years ago in 1866 when Henry Sherwin and Edward Williams founded the company in Cleveland, Ohio. The duo went on to shape an industry and create a global legacy. That legacy continues on today as we look ahead and continue to innovate our future. With stores, distribution centers and facilities spanning the globe, we're able to deliver the best in paints, coatings and related products to the world. From our headquarters to our 130 distribution centers and more than 4,000 retail locations, we continue to grow in new and exciting ways.
 



**Join our Family - Create your Possible** 




  





  





**Please note that Sherwin Williams is unable to respond to any enquiries, accept CVs or applications from Recruitment Agencies.** 




**About Us** 




 Here, we believe there’s not one path to success, we believe in careers that grow with you. Whoever you are or wherever you come from in the world, there’s a place for you at Sherwin-Williams. We provide you with the opportunity to explore your curiosity and drive us forward. We’ll give you the space to share your strengths and we want you to show us what you can do. You can innovate, grow and discover in a place where you can thrive!
 



 Eligibility to Work
 



 You will need to provide proof of right to work. It is a condition of any offer of employment we make to you that you have the permission to work in the country for the role for which you are applying for.
 



 Equal Opportunity Employer
 



 An equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, colour, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnic or national origin, disability, age pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, or any other protected characteristic prohibited by law.
 



 Please be aware, Sherwin-Williams recruiting team members will never request a candidate to provide a payment, ask for financial information, or sensitive personal information like national identification numbers, date of birth, or bank account numbers during the application process.

title: SAP Solution Architect (Nuclear Business)
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if we can rely on the reliable and competivive generation of our Nuclear plants. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing Vattenfall Nuclear to become a data driven company, allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

 This means we are architecting:
   

  

* Our enterprise asset management and logistics on SAP S/4HANA
* An integrated and hybrid SAP and surrounding systems landscape consisting of multiple instances (cloud and onpremise)
* Solutions that are critical to Swedish infrastructure and its society and thus regulated under Säkerhetsskyddslag (2018:585)
* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time to advance predictive maintenance use cases
* IT infrastructure and solutions that are hyper-scalable and reliable
* Strategic solutions/landscapes to optimize Nuclear maintenance strategies


 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make Nuclear run as
 *clockwork* 
 , you act as
 *timer* 
 to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an
 *alarm* 
 if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities:
   

  

* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Nuclear business on SAP, IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy and SAP strategy, etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Nuclear in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Nuclear and SAP domain knowledge to become the go-to point how advance its S/4 journey.
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Nuclear and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Our ideal candidate**
 We are looking for a seasoned Solution Architect, that has hands-on experience with SAP solution architecture, preferably (in prior assignments) as SAP Architect in water or energy utilities, manufacturing, or automotive.
   

  

 You feel comfortable communicating with both IT and non-IT colleagues on different levels in the organization. You enjoy being in an ever-changing environment. Furthermore, you bring:
   

  

* An academic degree in IT or related study
* You speak Swedish and English
* Experience with Enterprise Architecture and Frameworks in an international environment
* You have deep SAP technical knowledge and general IT knowledge
* Ideally you have worked in an asset intensive industry – and understand security considerations, IEC 62443, ISO27001 etc.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* Skills to produce enterprise ready architecture documents and todirect complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And we love architects talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location** 
 : for this position you are expected to be already based in Sweden with willingness to travel regularly to the office (Stockholm, Solna). Occasionally also travel to key Nuclear locations, like Ringhals, Forsmark, Oskarshamm or team meetings in Amsterdam and Berlin; You will be expected to travel approximately a once month for two days to these locations.
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


 Mer information
   

  

**About Vattenfall:**
 Energy is our contribution to quality of life – day after day. With around 20.000 colleagues Vattenfall provides comprehensive electricity and heating offerings to several million customers in northern Europe. For the work ahead we need people who are fully dedicated to our customers and to a sustainable society – people like you.
   

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, including CV and cover letter via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: Biståndshandläggare för vuxna, Huddinge kommun
description:
**Biståndshandläggare för vuxna, Huddinge kommun** 
  

  

  

  

****Om tjänsten****
  


 Bistånd och förebyggande verksamhet ansvarar för att, utifrån gällande lagstiftning, utreda och besluta om insatser/bistånd inom områdena funktionshinder och äldreomsorg. Verksamheten har drygt 80 medarbetare och kontoret ligger centralt i Huddinge centrum, nära pendeltåg och busstation.Målet för verksamheten är en mycket väl fungerande myndighetsutövning som präglas av rättssäkerhet, god service och hög kvalité. Vår arbetsplats kännetecknas av gott samarbete och ett öppet klimat där vi ser varandra som viktiga resurser för att utvecklas och nå våra mål.
 


  


 Enheten för myndighetsutövning inom funktionsstöd (FS) präglas av engagemang, driv och god sammanhållning. Vi värdesätter varandras kunskap och strävar gemensamt efter att ständigt utveckla vårt arbete för att säkerställa en rättssäker myndighetsutövning med god service. Enheten ansvarar för att utreda och fatta beslut om bistånd för personer inom funktionshinderomsorg i Huddinge kommun – neropsykiatri, LSS vuxna samt även övrigt bistånd enligt socialtjänstlagen (SoL) för personer mellan 18 och 64 år.
 


  


 Som biståndshandläggare för vuxna upp till 65 år utreder och beslutar du om övrigt bistånd enligt SoL samt arbetar med att följa upp beslutade insatser. Tjänsten är i en arbetsgrupp på fyra biståndshandläggare som ansvarar för utredningar om övrigt bistånd för vuxna personer i åldern 18 till och med 64 år. I arbetet möter du en stor variation av brukare och du arbetar regelbundet med samverkan inom socialtjänsten. Arbetet är självständigt samtidigt som du är en viktig del i ett team där gott samarbete är en förutsättning för att lyckas i uppdraget. Du har egen delegation på ett flertal insatser. Kollegiemöten hålls varje vecka för avstämning och stöd i arbetet. Som stöd i myndighetsutövningen finns kollegor, chefer och verksamhetsjurist nära i det dagliga arbetet.
 


  

****Vem är du?****
  


 Vi söker dig som är utbildad socionom eller har annan jämförbar högskoleutbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig. Erfarenhet av myndighetsutövning enligt Individens behov i centrum (IBIC) inom socialtjänst för vuxna och äldre ses som meriterande. Du har goda kunskaper om gällande lagstiftning, god förmåga att arbeta med olika IT-system samt förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift.
 


  


 För att bli framgångsrik i arbetet krävs att du är stabil och trygg i dig själv, bidrar till ett gott samarbetsklimat samt är empatisk och tydlig i mötet med brukare. Viktigt är också att du har ett gott omdöme och att du driver ditt arbete strukturerat och självständigt.
 


  


 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
 


  

  

****Varför Huddinge?****
  


 För att vi ska kunna utföra vårt uppdrag är du som medarbetare i Huddinge kommun det viktigaste vi har. Därför erbjuder vi en rad förmåner https://www.huddinge.se/arbete-och-karriar/arbeta-i-huddinge-kommun/formaner/ för ett hållbart arbetsliv och för att underlätta din vardag.
 


  


 Urval sker löpande.
 


  


 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 


  

****Upplysningar:****
  


 Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av Katja Merei, enhetschef tel. 08 535 378 29
 


  


 Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.
 


  

  

**Om arbetsplatsen** 
  

 Huddinge är en växande Stockholmskommun med närhet till både stad och natur. Som medarbetare hos oss är du en viktig samhällsbyggare. Tillsammans skapar vi ett hållbart samhälle för alla som bor, besöker och arbetar i Huddinge.
   

  

  

  

**Facklig kontaktperson** 
  


 För facklig kontaktperson för tjänsten se Facklig kontaktinformation
 


  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
  


  

 Anställningsform:
   

 Tillsvidareanställning
   




  


  

 Omfattning:
   

 Heltid
   




  

  

**Ansökan** 
  


  

  

 Ansök senast:
   

  

 2025-02-14
   




  


  

  

 Referensnummer:
   

  

 C231620
   




  

  

**Anställning** 
  


  

 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen:
   

 1
   




  

  


 Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.
 


  

**Filmer om Huddinge** 
  


 Vill du veta mer om vår syn på ledarskap och medarbetarskap eller Huddinges historia? Titta gärna på våra filmer

title: Lösningsarkitekt till hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen
description:
Är du en driven och lyhörd person? Vill du få möjlighet att bidra och ta ansvar i en samhällsviktig kontext? Nu söker Hälso och sjukvårdsförvaltningen en senior Lösningsarkitekt till sitt team. Här blir du en viktig kugge i vår arkitektfunktion och kan påverka med din erfarenhet och kompetens till vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I den här rollen blir du en nyckelspelare i både pågående initiativ och i att stärka vår arkitektoniska förmåga. I nära samarbete med dina kollegor vidareutvecklar du processer, metoder och verktyg för en hållbar, skalbar och säker IT-miljö. Du får möjlighet att påverka strategiska vägval, samarbeta med verksamhetsansvariga och andra arkitekter samt driva förädlingen av vår arkitektur. Genom kontinuerlig utveckling och effektiva samarbeten bidrar du till en framåtdriven digital transformation och gör konkret skillnad för patienter och vårdpersonal i hela regionen.
   

  

**Några av delarna i rollen:**
* ta en aktiv del i projekt
* bidra till att översätta process- och informationsmodeller mot behov och krav i system och flöden
* vara drivande inom din expertis


 Vidare bidrar du till att säkerställa att vi tillsammans tar hänsyn till processer, funktionella- och icke-funktionella krav såsom prestanda, skalbarhet, robusthet och förvaltningsbarhet på ett relevant sätt.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person är du lyhörd och driven med en förmåga att lyfta blicken. Vidare är du kommunikativ och skicklig på att visualisera, presentera och föra en dialog kring komplexa lösningar på ett konkret och lättillgängligt sätt. Du är dessutom utåtriktad med en god samarbetsförmåga. För att passa för rollen ser vi att du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område såsom exempelvis data/systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad genom gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

**Du har med dig erfarenhet av:**
* IT- och lösningsarkitektur
* att leda och ge stöd i arkitektur- och designarbete, tekniska vägval samt guida initiativ och ta fram arkitekturdesign
* arkitekturstyrning
* modellering i arkitekturverktyg som exempelvis Sparx Enterprise Architect
* att dokumentera och sammanställa arkitektur- och systemdokumentation
* både förvaltning och nyutveckling av projekt


 Vidare har du utmärkta kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift och vana vid agilt projektarbete samt att arbeta självständigt och målinriktat.
   

  

**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**
* arbete inom offentlig sektor
* hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn
* REST API, FHIR, IAM, Databas och katalogtjänster
* bakgrund inom utveckling
* storskaliga integrationslösningar
* stora komplexa system- och applikationslandskap


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Du erbjuds även kompetensutveckling i olika former som exempelvis nätverk, mentor- och adeptsprogram samt ledarutbildning.
   

  

 Vi sitter i ljusa fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

* Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. Sista ansökningsdag är den 23 februari. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Region Stockholm med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Linda Wallin, Rekryteringskonsult på 072 2276720, linda.wallin@foundryco.com.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tester kan komma att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. Vi använder oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är en personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett problemlösningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser.
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien, kris- och katastrofberedskap. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Senior Marketing Specialist
description:
**Crane Currency has an immediate position opening for a Senior Marketing Specialist, Based out of TUMBA.**
**Who We Are**
 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 Through a combination of your strategic and creative thinking you will propose new ways to engage digitally with existing and new accounts. You will be part of a team connecting with heads of state and national, central banks helping them understand the value of entrusting the security of their national currency to Crane Currency. You will conceive of and lead campaigns, building an online presence to engage with and grow Crane’s worldwide customer base. You will craft strategies that help your colleagues to expand the reach of Crane Currency’s products and expertise. National banks will regard your messaging and communications savvy as a model on how to advertise their national currency, the physical manifestation of a trusted central bank. The work you do will intimately link Crane Currency as a trusted partner on whom central banks can depend to secure their currency for decades ahead.
   

  

 As a Senior Marketing Specialist At Crane You Will
   

  

* Guide the company’s digital presence, including oversight of its Website and Social media platforms.
* Create, manage and champion the digital content delivery strategy to the company’s central bank customers to drive and sustain engagement.
* Support the preparations, execution of and post-event follow-up for Crane branded events, seminars and industry events.
* Coordinate photo and film sessions, including scheduling, logistics, and ensuring that all materials meet brand standards.
* Assist in the execution of targeted customer outreach and co-promotion campaigns via email, website, social media platforms, customer portal, and using in-person events, as well as Crane-branded events to grow and strengthen Central Bank customer engagement.
* Establish engagement metrics useful in measuring the efficacy of the plan and its campaigns.
* Ensure that activities align with company policies and operational systems regarding safety, environment, working environment, and quality.


**Required**
**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**
* Education: Associate’s degree in business-related field or commensurate experience.
* Experience: 7-10 years’ experience in marketing or PR functions with a B2G and/or B2B customer focus.
* Language:  Highly proficient in English, written and spoken.
* IT : Strong working knowledge in Microsoft Office suite,
* Demonstrable knowledge and working competence with Social Media accounts, e.g., LinkedIn; familiarity with W ordpress , Umbraco, and other website tools.


**Preferred**
* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, international business, or communications.


 Analytical focused studies (programming or statistics).
   

  

 Level B driving license or equivalent.
 **How we will care for you:**
* Top- notch medical benefits – We take care of you with our wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care .
* Personal development – We want you to grow with us . Through lunch & learns , career ladders and more .
* Community Engagement – Give yourself time to support the local community and environment through volunteer events and on-site initiatives to benefit local communities and organizations .
* There’s more – Competitive compensation , vacation , parental leave , and retirement plans.


**What Drives Our Team**
 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
   

  

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


 People are at the center of all that we do, from our employees to our customers and our communities. We empower our teams to help shape the Crane Currency experience, embracing and celebrating our unique perspectives and differences to learn from each other and grow stronger together. To learn more about life at Crane Currency, visit .
   

  

**Where We Are**
 Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, 10-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Tumba is a small suburb in an area with different cultures from all corners of the world. The area offers a beautiful landscape and countryside feeling. You can spend the day to explore the shopping mall nearby, enjoy the surrounding nature, or take the train into the vibrant pulse of Stockholm City to enjoy the many restaurants, shopping, sightseeing and stroll through beautiful Downtown, Gamla Stan.
   

  

 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
   

  

 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.
   

  

 #CCY
   

  

 #ONSITE #HYBRID
   

  

 -KP1
