title: Multicloud Co-Prime Account Executive
description:
**Job Description**
 Oracle has set itself apart by developing
 **partnerships** 
 with the other
 **Top Cloud Hyperscalers** 
 in the world and as part of our Cloud Growth strategy, we are opening an opportunity for a
 **Senior Sales Executive** 
 to work on designated
 **Multicloudaccounts to drive** 
**Cloud platform** 
 selling. The Multicloud Sales Exec will be accountable for
 **partnering closely with our customers´C-suite and cloud hyperscalers such as Google, AWS, MSFT.** 
 The
 **Multicloud Co-Prime Sales** 
 will play a critical role in identifying and developing new business opportunities with a set of specific accounts, nurturing existing and long lasting senior relationships at our customers and in partnership with Google, AWS, MSFT, and signing new contracts and projects with these customers to drive Cloud consumption and achieve revenue growth. In this role you will be a critical member of our EMEA Technology community.
   

  

**Description What You’ll Do**
 Be the vital piece of the puzzle that connects us to the millions of businesses that need our help to evolve. You will.
   

  

* Develop and maintain senior and long lasting relationships with Key customers to understand their needs and identify new opportunities and partner closely with counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT based on the setup of our customers.
* Lead IaaS/PaaS technology deals across its assigned customers patch using world leading cloud offerings from Oracle
* Drive Platform selling approach as well as promote and evangelize Oracle products to a selected customer, partners, and internal audiences
* Contribute and lead in account planning, customer/market analysis, and strategy sessions
* Develop relationships and collaborate with our partners to define, recommend, and drive sales
* Expert in developing appropriate sales programs and solutions; maintain up-to-date competitive information and compile regional success stories
* Work closely with the sales team, counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT to identify and pursue new business opportunities on the targeted account or provide opportunity support for Prime Sales teams and Partner Sales teams within your territory.
* Collaborate with our Center of Excellent technical team to develop and deliver customized solutions for customers.
* Encourage and support the adoption and consumption of our IT operation management as well as monitoring in the cloud.
* Lead successful go-to-market campaigns by working closely with internal marketing specialists
* Be a champion for Oracle’s Cloud strategy, capable of articulating this to customers and partners
* Build and maintain relationships with relevant Oracle LOBs to ensure resources are available when required.


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**What You’ll Bring**
 Your passion, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us become the number one cloud company in the world. We also look for:
   

  

* A strong interest in technology, passion for sales and strong communication skills.
* Solution seller: Able to understand quickly business needs and establish trust. Must be able to show the full value proposition of Oracle Cloud. Not only the technical side of selling Cloud but the business gain for the customer.
* Connected: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with customers. Able to use Oracle ecosystem to navigate within a customer to identify targets and opportunities. Establish close partnership with counterparts at Google, AWS, MSFT,
* Proven track record of success in driving revenue growth and achieving sales targets.
* Cloud confident : Able to outline the full Oracle Cloud picture and explain Universal Credits commercials
* Hands-On : Able to personally demo or give quick hands-on example of Cloud usage “on the spot”, without needing to always engage technical resources
* Value driven : Able to identify real use-cases for Cloud in the customer that drive value for the customer and can lead to rapid expansion of original deals
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Proven successful and highly attuned influencing skills.
* Proficient in English.


 Does this sound like you? If so, we hope to meet you!
   

  

*At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before*
**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager (SaaS)
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a smart compliance SaaS platform that simplifies ESG, GRC, and Strategic work processes. We’re now looking for a Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our marketing team of eight in Stockholm.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll play a key part in guiding our customers through their journey with us. Using tools like HubSpot, you’ll create smart e-mail marketing initiatives and automated workflows that deliver the right message at the right time.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who loves combining data and creativity to drive results. You’ll analyze customer behavior, test new strategies, and continuously improve how we engage with our customers and prospects. All while being part of a collaborative, fun, and ambitious team that wins together.
   

  

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
 **💡****
* An engaging work environment with people who share a mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Opportunities to learn about GRC, ESG, Strategic work processes and work with both the public and private sectors.
* Challenging, varied, and rewarding tasks with room to be independent and innovative.
* A high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Take a look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture!
* Work from a fantastic and central office in one of Hötorgsskraporna in Stockholm.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about them here!


**About The Role  📌**
 As our Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you’ll be at the heart of our customer journey strategy—designing and optimizing nurturing flows, campaigns, and communication that drive engagement and growth.
   

  

 Your focus will be to:
   

  

* Attract and convert leads into high-intent MQLs to fuel our sales pipeline.
* Engage and grow our customer base with targeted, relevant communication.
* Find ways through email marketing and automation to both retain our customers as well as grow with them through upsell and cross-sell.
* Ensure sign ups, attendance, and follow up on webinars and events.


 Your primary tool will be HubSpot, where you’ll automate workflows, track performance, and continuously test new approaches—including AI-driven strategies—to refine and improve our communication.
   

  

 This is a highly collaborative role, working closely with marketing, sales, and our Data/AI team to optimize customer engagement and drive growth. A perfect mix of data and creativity, where you’ll have the space to experiment, optimize, and make a real impact.
   

  

**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️**
* 3 years of experience in B2B marketing automation or lifecycle marketing, ideally within SaaS.
* HubSpot is your go-to tool — you know how to get the most out of it but are always curious about new features and better ways of working.
* You understand customer needs and can spot patterns that drive engagement.
* Expertise of lead nurturing, lead scoring, and CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization).
* An educational background in Marketing, Marketing Automation, or a related field (Higher Vocational Education, Bachelor's, or Master's level).
* You’re fluent in Swedish and based in Stockholm.


**It’s a bonus if you have:**
* Experience with tools like DreamData or similar attribution and insights tools.
* Experience with GA4.


**About You 👀**
 You’re someone who loves the mix of data, systems, and communication. You enjoy digging into customer insights, finding patterns, and figuring out how to reach the right audience at the right time. You thrive in a role where you can test new ideas, optimize workflows, and see the results of your work.
   

  

 Collaboration is key in this role, and you’re someone who naturally connects with others. Whether it’s brainstorming with marketing colleagues, working closely with sales, or asking for input from other teams, you know how to build relationships and get things done.
   

  

 You’re also someone who finds satisfaction in the details – from analyzing campaign performance to tweaking email flows until they’re just right. If you love seeing systems work smarter and enjoy the challenge of making complex processes simple, this role is for you.
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
   

  

 Is this particular role not quite right for you -  Show your interest by connecting with us, we are constantly looking for new talent for our growing business in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook.

title: Director of Brand and Buzz
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Is creating outstanding global brands and high-performing teams your thing? Are you up for a challenge and want to think BIG? Are you a doer who can get things moving? Well, then keep on reading.
   

  

 With the vision of transforming the way we do meetings and lectures by turning passive groups into active contributors, Mentimeter is growing rapidly across the globe. With more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, we are on our way to making the world a better place, one Menti at a time. Since the launch in 2012, we have set up offices in Stockholm, Toronto, and Sydney.
   

  

 We are looking for a Director of Brand and Buzz to make us top of mind for 1 billion knowledge workers across the globe. (Yep, you are right - that is every single knowledge worker on the planet.)
   

  

**What We Bring To You**
* A culture-transforming product that is loved by its customers and users.
* A unique value-driven and profitable international scaleup, renowned for its great company culture and employee focus.
* The opportunity to work with genuinely inclusive, intelligent, and ambitious people, solving interesting problems together.
* A role with extraordinary impact combined with a whole lot of fun. (We take our work, but not ourselves too seriously.)


**The role in a nutshell**
 As the Director of Brand and Buzz, you’ll be the creative right hand of the CMO, driving and leading our brand strategy and brand identity. You'll lead a creative in-house team and be the partner and brand confidant for sales, product, the people team, the finance team, and every team at Mentimeter. You're obsessed with creating an impact for our customers and users, and you know how to create movements and raving fans. You understand that in order to create a unique brand personality, you need to talk to the heart. And you know that in order to gain trust from the CEO and investors, you need to talk to the head.
   

  

**The Mission**
* To create a world-leading brand and transform the way meetings and classes are held
* To ensure a bold, premium brand that stands out - bringing our brand to life by leading and driving the marketing department’s multi-channel communications strategy, including but not limited to thought leadership, PR, social media, and content marketing. events, trade shows, podcasts, and live shows might also be a part of it. Strive towards a consistent brand experience in all channels and touchpoints, and in close collaboration with the product team and the sales team.
* Lead to succeed - Lead, grow, and build a high-performing in-house creative team.
* Track, analyze, and tweak - Show the impact of brand initiatives in numbers, stay close to data and performance, analyze the outcome and act on the findings.
* Getting everyone on board - By utilizing great stakeholder management and communication skills, you’ll ensure that we are on board and on the same page. You'll collaborate and work closely with leaders across Mentimeter to ensure brand consistency.
* Thinking BIG and small - Set the big vision and break it down into concrete actions and projects to make the vision happen.


**Who You Are**
* You have a strong track record leading creative marketing functions in international, enterprise, and/or product-led SaaS businesses. (When I say pipeline, demand generation, field marketing, acquisition, web, digital, and product marketing, you know what I am talking about.)
* You have demonstrable ownership of an international brand and content vision and have planned and successfully delivered against associated targets and budgets.
* You are an experienced leader who loves helping people grow and succeed, knowing that a leader's success is tied to the success of their team. Leading diverse global marketing teams, including in-house talent, agencies, and contractors, comes naturally to you. You're skilled at leading creative teams and bringing out their best, with a passion for brand building, design, and communication.
* You thrive in fast-paced environments and can juggle creative ideas with a strategic mindset while rolling up your sleeves to get things done when needed.
* You excel in verbal and written communication in English. (However, you don't have to know Swedish at all. Daily work is carried out in English, and the Mentimeter team is composed of more than 50+ different nationalities.)
* You are accustomed to being the brand budget owner, negotiating with vendors, and ensuring results from investments.
* You have a proven ability to collaborate with all levels within the organization as a tactical and strategic partner, coach, and advisor.
* You have a growth mindset, are willing to take risks, and think big.


 Wow, that turned out to be a lot of information... But just one last thing before you apply, perhaps the most important one: as the Director of Brand & Buzz, we want you to be a part of shaping the role. If you don't tick all the boxes, please apply anyway!
   

  

 This will be fun!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior teknisk specialist - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Är du en proaktiv poblemlösare med god förståelse av IT-system och nätverk, som vill ansluta dig till ett av nordens största IT-bolag? Som on-site teknisk specialist hos Tietoevry Tech Services kommer du att vara ansvarig för att tillhandahålla teknisk support på plats, hantera Windows-servermiljöer och säkerställa smidig drift av IT-infrastrukturen.
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som on-site senior teknisk specialist kommer du:**
* Tillhandahålla praktisk teknisk support för hård- och mjukvaruproblem hos kunder eller på företaget.
* Felsöka och lösa problem med stationära datorer, bärbara datorer, skrivare och andra kringutrustningar.
* Installera, konfigurera och underhålla datorsystem och mjukvaruapplikationer.
* Övervaka serverprestanda, tillämpa säkerhetsuppdateringar och säkerställa efterlevnad av säkerhetsstandarder.
* Utföra säkerhetskopiering, återställningar och testa katastrofåterställningsplaner.
* Hjälpa till med konfigurering och underhåll av nätverksenheter (t.ex. routrar, switchar, brandväggar).
* Upprätthålla korrekt dokumentation av system, konfigurationer och rutiner samt ge regelbundna rapporter om systemprestanda, incidenter och lösningar.
* Tillhandahålla utbildning och vägledning till slutanvändare om bästa praxis och IT-policyer.
* Tjänsten kräver resor till kund- eller företagslokaler för support på plats i Stockholm.
* Tjänsten kan innebära arbete utanför ordinarie arbetstid eller jourarbete beroende på verksamhetens behov.


**Vem vi söker:**
* Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av en liknande teknisk supportroll.
* Utmärkta felsöknings- och problemlösningsfärdigheter.
* Starka kommunikations- och interpersonella färdigheter.
* Relevanta certifieringar.
* Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Fick vi dig inspirerad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, Daniel Tercha, daniel.tercha @tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att utveckla digitala framtider där företag, samhällen och mänskligheten frodas.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

 Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Mechanical testing engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **2+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Assignment
   

  

 Mechanical testing engineer
   

  

 Where will the assignment be performed
   

  

 (Onsite, Hybrid, offsite)
   

  

 75 % onsite, 25 % home office
   

  

 Education
   

  

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related fields Language
   

  

 Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
   

  

 Meriting
   

  

 At least 2 years of experience in mechanical testing
   

  

 Knowledge of measurement acquisition and analyzing software
   

  

 General knowledge of heavy vehicles
   

  

 Fluency in Swedish
   

  

 Practical mechanics skills
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: School Relationship Executive (APAC)
description:
**Are you a dynamic and commercially minded young professional who loves travel and meeting new people? Join a dynamic business at an exciting stage of growth, and support 100's of schoo** 
**ls around the world to solve the global teacher crisis.**
 We think you will thrive in this role if you:
   

  

* Are a confident, dynamic person who is able to engage with stakeholders at all levels and build strong relationships with individuals and businesses
* Equipped with a few relevant years of commercial experience in sales and business development
* Are an avid world traveller looking for an opportunity to gain significant experience that would usually come much later in your career
* Possess a commercial mindset, keen to develop industry knowledge, sales and marketing skills essential to a future in any commercial industry


**Lanterna is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and although we are open to hybrid-remote, our preference is for a Stockholm based candidate.**
**About Lanterna Education**
 Lanterna is a dynamic, fast-growing online teaching company dedicated to unlocking every student's potential. We provide exceptional live online education to IB (International Baccalaureate) students worldwide, delivered by a network of top IB graduates and outstanding IB teachers. Together with our sister company Kognity, we are on a mission to radically improve learning for the world's students. Our environment is vibrant, caring, and creatively charged.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Lanterna’s Schools team solves the teacher crisis for a global network of schools, providing short and long-term online teaching coverage. Although Lanterna has been around for almost 20 years, providing unrivalled tutoring and prep courses for students, the B2B arm of our business is still nascent but growing extremely fast. In our first full year of operation, we have grown rapidly, now serving over 100 IB schools around the world.
   

  

 You will be joining at an exciting time, with an established and loved business model, and huge potential for growth over the coming years. We're a vibrant and fun small team spread across Europe, and we're looking for passionate individuals to join us on our mission to transform learning.
   

  

 As we serve a global market of schools, we have split our territories into the Americas, EMEA and APAC (Asia Pacific). This role will drive sales and growth for the entire Asia Pacific region which will mean meeting stakeholders during their time zones and in their regions, so get ready to travel! You will work closely with the SREs for the Americas and EMEA to make group-wide decisions and will be responsible for your own sales and marketing budget for your territory.
   

  

 We really believe in what we offer, and you will have the exciting job of letting the IB world know about it. In any given week, you will be attending a conference, travelling to Asia to run demos for school leaders exploring our school solutions, or busy on email and phone doing outreach to generate leads building a pipeline of future opportunities.
   

  

 You will be meeting so many interesting and important people across the international school sector that your strategic thinking will also be important, picking up on trends in the industry which we can use to enhance our product, as well as our marketing and sales techniques.
   

  

 We're not just looking for a team member – we're looking for a future leader. Over the next 2 to 3 years, you may have the opportunity to build and lead your own team under your expert guidance.
   

  

**About You**
* A recent university graduate (0-5 years) or junior teacher with an IB background
* Boundless and infectious enthusiasm for international education
* A ‘can do’ attitude which will see you taking phone calls from airports and designing marketing initiatives on train rides
* A extremely strong bias to action
* Extremely tech-savvy, with CRM experience a bonus
* Inspire trust in customers and partners through tonality and dialogue
* A team player who celebrates overall success more than their own
* Working knowledge of Asian-Pacific business culture and schools is a bonus


**Skills**
**Energetic:** 
 You will be on the move!
   

  

**Communication:** 
 In this role, every week will be different, and so positive, engaging communication is key. You will also deal with stakeholders at all levels, and so being relatable both to senior and junior stakeholders is vital.
   

  

**Growth mindset:** 
 We need talent with the capacity and desire to manage, direct and impact our future. Is that you?
   

  

**Organisational Skills:** 
 Highly organised both individually and as a manager, with hunger for taking on wider responsibilities across our fast growing company.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 We pride ourselves on our diversity, openness, flat hierarchy, transparency, authenticity, entrepreneurial spirit, and team orientation. We seek ambitious individuals who are not only eager to make a meaningful impact but are also committed to continuous self-improvement and to enhancing the capabilities of their colleagues.
   

  

**Interview process**
**Intro Call with Team Lead:** 
 Have an informal 10 minute chat with Tim to learn more about the role and ensure it is a cultural match
 ***.***
**Hiring Manager Hangout:** 
 Connect with Tim & Eric (VP Sales) for a more in-depth conversation. Uncover the nitty-gritty details of the role and get to know each other.
   

  

**Meet the wider team:** 
 Online meet and greet with the rest of the schools team
   

  

**Case study** 
 : Solve a real schools marketing challenge and present your case to the team.
   

  

**We are looking for someone who can join our team soon. We hope that's you!**

title: Senior IAM Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a dedicated Senior IAM Infrastructure Engineer to join us in our mission to contribute to a greener future. The role is a part of our excellent Operations & Infrastructure team based in Stockholm. By joining us, you will be a key player in building one of the first large scale European battery factories.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The Senior IAM Infrastructure Engineer will;
   

  

* Take the lead in developing and configuring the automatic lifecycle workflows of Northvolt’s Identities and access management.
* Collaborate closely with IAM Architect, IT teams within Digitalization Business Unit to lead the technical implementation or modification to the IAM infrastructure in Northvolt.
* Provide expert support to IT Service Support in resolving IAM infrastructure incidents and addressing customer issues promptly.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, IAM updates, procedures, and policies to keep the IT team and management informed about changes and developments.
* Expert in Identity & Access Management concept.
* Drive continuous improvement and automation efforts, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of existing IAM & MDM workflows.
* Expert in MDM (Mobile Device Management) and proficiently handle device lifecycle management within Intune.
* Be a driver in the use of infrastructure as code, familiar with both GitHub and Terraform.
* Follow the SCRUM framework or Agile methodology as a standard practice in the team's ways of working.


**Key Responsibilities Include (but Are Not Limited To)**
* Recognize and address Entra ID related problems in the IAM infrastructure.
* Offer technical assistance for issues arising in the IAM and its associated IT infrastructure.
* Ensure high-quality technical and procedural documentation.
* Act as the primary contact for handling technical escalations.
* Lead and mentor junior members of the IAM team, guiding them in technical matters and best practices.
* Assist in reviewing technical Change Advisory Board requests falling under the IAM domain.


 Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development. For us it’s important to look at your skills and potential, please refrain form including your picture and age with your application to help us with this.
   

  

 Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Full time employment, fixed salary.
   

  

 Planned starting date is asap.
   

  

*Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.*
*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*
**Skills & Requirements**
**We believe that you have** 
**:**
* Proficient in integrating IAM platform (Entra ID) with connected source and target systems,


 utilizing tools like Logic Apps or Graph API.
   

  

* Experienced in configuring User, Group & Identity & Governance Administration workflows in


 Azure Active Directory/Entra ID in alignment with established policies.
   

  

* Knowledgeable in OAuth & Authentication mechanisms, ensuring secure access control.
* Skilled in working with both Linux and Windows platforms, adapting to diverse environments.
* Adept at Application onboarding & SSO configuration with Entra ID, facilitating seamless


 authentication across systems.
   

  

* Familiarity with PowerShell Graph Modules, enabling efficient interaction with Microsoft Graph


 API.
   

  

* Possessing a solid understanding of basic network concepts, aiding in IAM implementation.
* Proficient in scripting languages such as bash and PowerShell, automating various tasks.
* Knowledgeable in MDM platforms design and operations, ensuring effective device


 management.
   

  

* Adept at troubleshooting diverse technology problems, offering timely resolutions.
* Experienced in handling CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) and


 implementing DevOps practices, ensuring efficient software delivery.
   

  

* Understanding cloud architectures and concepts (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS), enabling cloud-based


 IAM solutions.
   

  

* Familiarity with basic security protocols, ensuring robust security measures are in place.


 Soft Skills
   

  

* Communicating complex information to a non-technical audience.
* Strong organisational acumen.
* Building trust and relationship with parties across all areas of the business (networking)
* Able to set priorities and personal goals

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: School Relationship Executive (APAC)
description:
Are you a passionate and commercially-minded professional with an entrepreneurial spirit and a drive to deliver impactful solutions? Join a fast growing EdTech company and play a pivotal role in addressing global school challenges, building strong connections, and exploring new opportunities.
   

  

 For nearly 20 years, Lanterna has provided exceptional tutoring and prep courses. Now, through our expanding Schools team, we are tackling the global teacher crisis by delivering online teaching solutions to over 150 IB schools worldwide. With nearly 4,000 IB schools globally, and 800 specifically in the APAC region, this is an exciting opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing B2B team, driving sales and fostering growth across the region.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will** 
  

  

* Serve as the primary contact for Lanterna in the region, representing us to all clients.
* Lead outreach efforts and build a robust pipeline through:
+ Outbound calls, emails, and other marketing activities.
+ Attending conferences (2–3 times per year).
+ Traveling to the region to connect with schools (2–3 times per year).
+ Manage the sales and marketing strategy for your territory.

* Collaborate with colleagues across the globe.
* Identify industry trends to enhance our products, marketing, and sales strategies.


 Looking ahead, this role offers the potential to grow into a leadership position, with opportunities to build and lead your own team within 2–3 years.
   

  

 We believe you will thrive in this role if you:
   

  

* Are a confident and dynamic professional, skilled at engaging stakeholders at all levels and building strong relationships with individuals and businesses across the APAC region.
* Have several years of relevant commercial experience in sales and business development, with a proven track record of driving growth.
* Are an ambitious explorer, eager to leave your mark by building and expanding a market with limitless potential.
* Possess a commercial mindset, a strong interest in developing industry expertise, and the sales and marketing skills essential for success in any commercial sector.


 The following skills will set you up for success in this role:
   

  

* Energy: You thrive in a fast-paced environment and always be on the move!
* CRM Expertise: You maintain a clean and organized dashboard to ensure seamless operations.
* Communication: With every week bringing something new, positive and engaging communication is essential.
* Growth Mindset: We’re looking for someone with the talent, capacity, and ambition to manage, direct, and shape our future.
* Organizational Skills: Highly organized both individually and as a manager, with a strong appetite for taking on broader responsibilities within our rapidly growing company.


**Our Candidate Wishlist**
* Amazing attitude
* Passion for Sales / Commercial activity
* Experience in APAC region
* IB or Education Industry knowledge
* Located in Stockholm


**Job Location**
 Lanterna is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and although we are open to hybrid-remote, our preference is for a Stockholm based candidate.
   

  

**About Lanterna Education**
 Lanterna is a dynamic, fast-growing online teaching company dedicated to unlocking every student's potential. We provide exceptional live online education to IB (International Baccalaureate) students worldwide, delivered by a network of top IB graduates and outstanding IB teachers. Our environment is vibrant, caring, and creatively charged.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 We pride ourselves on our diversity, transparency, authenticity, entrepreneurial spirit, and team orientation. We seek ambitious individuals who are not only eager to make a meaningful impact but are also committed to continuous self-improvement and to enhancing the capabilities of their colleagues.
   

  

**Interview process**
* Intro Call with Team Lead: Have an informal 10 minute chat with Eric to learn more about the role and ensure it is a cultural match.
* Hiring Manager Hangout: Connect with Tim (CLO) & Eric (VP Sales) for a more in-depth conversation. Uncover the nitty-gritty details of the role and get to know each other.
* Meet the wider team: Online meet and greet with the rest of the schools team
* Case study: Solve a real school marketing challenge and present your case to the team.
* We are looking for someone who can join our team soon. We hope that's you!

title: Product Manager - Field Service App
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

**Aira's background**
 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland where we produce our heatpumps, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**Are you passionate about creating tools that make work easier and more efficient?**
 We are looking for a Product Manager to lead the development of tools tailored to our installers, service technicians and customer service representatives. Aira's 800+ installers across three markets are the driving force behind ensuring our customers enjoy warm and comfortable homes. In this role you will develop tools that ensure that their work becomes efficient, that we can provide high quality installations and that we can collect data from installations that can further improve our processes. The tools will be a cornerstone of our operations and a key driver of our success.
   

  

 Our business is traditionally a non-digital sector, but Aira’s vertical business model where we cover everything from manufacturing, sales, system design and installation gives us an unique opportunity to digitize and optimize installations.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Drive the development of tools that empower our installers, service technicians and customer care agents. Continuously analyze and improve tools to enhance user experience and streamline workflows. Develop tools that enables us to collect data from our installations, facilitating feedback loops and data-driven decisions and development.
* You will own the product roadmap, prioritize feature development, and work with stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of high-impact tools.
* Collaborate with other cross-functional teams targeting the same end users to ensure a coherent user experience.
* Act as a bridge between technical development and end-users, ensuring a seamless implementation process.


**You bring experience with most of the following:**
* Leading product development for internal tools, ideally used by field based workforce and/or in the customer support or aftersales domain.
* Successful experience of working across various markets within fast-growing scaleups.
* Expertise in crafting customer experience-centric product strategies, aligning vision, goals, and roadmap for optimal results in both e-commerce and/or SaaS settings, with a focus on heightened customer care, technical excellence, and customer retention.
* Working with CRMs (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and developing tools for ticket management or customer service automation.
* Adept at prioritizing features based on stakeholder feedback, market analysis, and business objectives to maximize product value and support e-commerce or SaaS product growth.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business Administration, Engineering, or a related discipline) is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in Italian, German, or French is preferred, with the ability to effectively communicate in a multicultural environment.


**What is in it for you?**
* Take an active part in the success of Aira and digitizing a vertical which is traditionally a non-digital sector.
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer, Front End (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:** 
 Agoda’s front-end teams focus on various product aspects including accommodations, flights, and payments. We build localized, optimized user experiences globally across mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites, fostering innovation and constant improvement through data-driven practices.
   

  

**The Opportunity:** 
 Agoda is looking for developers optimizing user interfaces that enhance the user experience for millions of travelers worldwide. This position requires a deep understanding of front-end development principles, a passion for crafting exceptional user experiences, and expertise in various front-end technologies. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Architecting and developing high-performance, cross-platform web applications
* Leading the design and implementation of Backend-for-Frontend (BFF) services
* Establishing and enforcing best practices for front-end testing and quality assurance
* Driving initiatives to optimize Core Web Vitals and overall application performance
* Owning a big chunk of Agoda’s system all the way from the north-star & vision down to the bytecode level
* Enabling impactful collaboration and cross-team projects on big projects, making a dent in the quality of our services, code & architecture
* Providing thoughtful feedback, nurture an inclusive engineering environment, and champion engineering fundamentals. Bring out the best from your fellow engineers
* Identifying and implementing opportunities for optimization across the technology stack, focusing on cost, efficiency, velocity & dev happiness
* Exhibiting technical leadership throughout the broader organization, conveying complex technical trade-offs to non-techies such as business owners & C-suite executives


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* Overall experience of 10+ years in engineering roles
* Proven hands-on experience with owning production services with significant impact on design, development, deployment, monitoring & evolution
* Curiosity, staying on the cutting-edge of technological improvements and open source advancement.
* Advanced proficiency in modern JavaScript frameworks and state management solutions
* Deep understanding of cross-platform development challenges and solutions
* Extensive experience with Backend-for-Frontend (BFF) patterns and micro-frontend architecture
* Expert-level knowledge of front-end testing methodologies, tools, and best practices
* Proven track record of optimizing applications for Core Web Vitals and web performance
* Strong understanding of web security, accessibility standards, and SEO best practices
* Can perform deep research & take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and also works great as part of a pack
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


**It’s great if you have:**
* A Master’s or Ph.D. in a technical field
* Deep understanding of React and state managers (Redux, Zustand, Valtio)
* Experience with C# and .Net Core
* Experience with Kotlin or other JVM languages


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**
 #sanjose #losangeles #sydney #melbourne #perth #brussels #saopaolo #vancouver #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #copenhagen #helsinki #paris #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #jerusalem #manila #moscow #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #istanbul #london #wroclaw #warsaw #rio #chennai #pune #toronto #austin #sydney #chichago #noida #delhi #seattle #hyderabad #gurgaon #newyork #bangalore #boston #bengaluru #berlin #mumbai #stockholm #barcelona #IT #ENG #5
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: NetSuite Swedish Speaking Sales Development Representative
description:
**Job Description**
**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Representative (SDR) Role**
 The SDR role provides a hands-on experience, sourcing and qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. We are looking to hire our next superstar sales representative to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. Within this role, you will get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. It is an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow you to contribute to our ongoing success.

* NetSuite Instagram
* Netsuite Website

title: R&D Quality Control Manager
description:
**R&D Quality Control Manager**
===============================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


Head of R&D Operational Excellence- PCP

### **Your role and responsibilities**


We are looking for an experienced engineer for the global R&D of the Process Control Platform organization. Our unit designs control systems products and instrumentations for the power, water and industries. Our portfolio includes a complete state-of-the-art automation solution for traditional markets such as thermal and water as well as challenging and ever evolving renewable markets such as solar, wind and hydro. Reporting to the Head of R&D Quality, you will perform quality control activities working in strong collaboration with our development teams, supporting but also challenging them with the application of the development process and meeting the quality standards. The Quality Control Manager ensures the quality management system works properly and involve people in the organization to advise on changes, how to implement them and provide training, tools, and techniques to achieve quality standards. • Ensures a common way of working and reporting by managing and maintaining R&D processes. Assures that mandatory processes, procedures and standards are followed. • Monitors product and system quality by gathering relevant data, defining, and tracking quality KPIs. • Supports the agile teams on the application of the Quality Management System and advises the streams in the implementation of quality assurance activities. • Makes objective evaluations by doing audits, reviews, and random samples to ensure adequate quality and process compliance of the work in progress. • Supports setting the Quality Goals for development and system streams. • Independent auditor of quality against the release criteria, provides feedback to projects and management. • Collaborates with continuous improvement team to drive Improvement projects. • Coaching and training the organization and the teams.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* 3 to 5 years of professional experience in quality management, verification, testing, operational excellence or similar.
* Knowledge and experience of software development and/or in developing hardware solutions.
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Azure DevOps and Power BI is a plus.
* A high level of self-motivation, curiosity and desire to learn about new technologies.
* Structured, result-oriented, analytical and capable of working efficiently with parallel activities, does not compromise on quality.
* A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.
* Facilitator and moderator skills in leading and influencing stakeholders.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English is required.

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Tatianna Jonsson, +46 722 013 628, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Kenneth Hultman, +46 703 49 60 95; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Mikael Hammar, +46 730 88 70 60. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Irma Leijon +46 724 612 314. The ABB Process Automation PCP is responsible for develop and deliver the most capable DCS products on the market, 800xA, which is the market leading product suite within the Industrial Automation DCS market. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Project Manager-Stockholm,Hybrid
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Project Manager**

* **Location:** Stockholm, Sweden
* **Job Type:** Hybrid

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our** **Project Manager**

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


We are seeking a **Project Manager** to lead a **Digital Experience Monitoring (DEX) / Proactive Monitoring Platform pre-study** for our client in the **retail industry**. This role focuses on enhancing workplace digital experience by identifying and evaluating **DEX monitoring solutions** for employee devices such as laptops and mobile phones. The consultant will be responsible for collecting requirements, evaluating solutions, engaging with suppliers, and delivering a final recommendation.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead the **pre-study** on Digital Experience Monitoring solutions.
* Gather requirements from **various internal teams**.
* Shortlist potential solutions based on past experience with DEX platforms.
* Engage with **potential suppliers** alongside stakeholders.
* Evaluate shortlisted solutions with **stakeholders**.
* Deliver a **final recommendation** outlining pros and cons, aligned with the organization’s needs.
* 

**Requirements:**

* **5+ years of experience** in technical project management.
* Proven ability to drive initiatives **from start to finish**.
* Strong **communication skills** with experience managing multiple stakeholders.
* Ability to **work independently** while collaborating within a team environment.
* In-depth understanding of **Digital Experience Monitoring / Proactive Monitoring platforms**.

  

**Why Join Us?**



Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.


You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

**Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se**

**Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.**

 **How to Apply:**


Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

  

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior DevOps
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Java utveckling
* Erfarenhet av Linux-utvecklingsmiljö
* Atlassian paketet (ex. Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)
* GIT
* Agil mjukvaruutveckling
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD
* Erfarenhet av automation
* Erfarenhet av byggmiljöer
* Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 12-02-2025  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
