title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
*Be part of a transformative cloud migration journey at Zenseact! We're seeking a Platform Engineer to join Team Freebird in modernizing our Software Factory infrastructure by moving from on-premises to AWS cloud, implementing modern DevOps practices, and building a robust cloud platform from the ground up.*  



#### **What is Software Factory?**

Software Factory is our development and delivery platform that powers Zenseact's journey from code to production vehicles. As the backbone of our development process, it orchestrates a sophisticated CI/CD pipeline that builds, tests, and delivers our Autonomous Driving and Advanced Driver Assist Systems software with precision and reliability.


To accomplish this, we leverage cutting-edge technologies like Bazel for efficient compilation and caching, container orchestration with Kubernetes for scalable workloads, Continuous integration pipelines that validate every code change, Artifact management and distribution systems, monitoring and observability solutions, self-service developer tools and services. The Software Factory team maintains the hybrid setup of in-house developed and upstream tools ecosystem to continuously improve developer experience, automation, and delivery speed. We're now embarking on an exciting modernization journey, migrating our platform from on-premises infrastructure to AWS cloud services, embracing modern DevOps practices and cloud-native architectures.  

  



#### **Insights from team Freebird**


We're a newly formed platform engineering team leading Zenseact's cloud transformation journey. Our mission is to migrate the Software Factory from its current on-premises infrastructure (running on VMs and Kubernetes) to a modern, cloud-native platform built on AWS EKS. We're building more than just infrastructure - we're creating a robust cloud foundation that emphasizes security, governance, and developer experience.


Trust and autonomy are key to how we operate in Team Freebird. We own our roadmap, our processes, and most importantly, our mistakes. While we are committed and embrace innovation, we're pragmatic in our approach, —choosing battle-tested solutions over custom builds when possible.


We are looking for someone with industry experience in DevOps and platform engineering who is curious, proactive, and open to new perspectives. Our team isn’t tied to specific tools or solutions—we focus on finding the most effective ones. We iterate quickly, encourage experimentation, and continuously refine our approach while keeping user experience at the center. As we transition to the cloud, experience with cloud migrations or working in cloud environments would be beneficial.

#### **Your mission and day-to-day tasks**

* **Influence and Grow:** Take an active role in shaping both our roadmap and your career trajectory.
* **Enhance Developer Experience:** Collaborate with our team to improve our CI environment and overall developer experience.
* **Own the Process:** Drive projects from initial ideation to production, ensuring reliability, performance, and availability.
* **Mentorship and Collaboration**: Mentor and support team members, contribute to design discussions, and work closely with the team to develop robust solutions.

### **What’s in it for you**

* Enjoy a flexible work approach and a genuinely good work/life balance. We do our best, when all individuals feel their best
* A competitive compensation and benefits package
* Work at the forefront of tech in one of Sweden’s biggest and most interesting and dynamic AI/ML-companies
* Collaborate with highly skilled, innovative people from all over the world, at the edge of both industry and academia

#### **Qualifications & experience**

##### **You will be well-suited if you have:**

* Strong experience with cloud platforms, particularly AWS services and cloud-native architectures
* Experience with a production Kubernetes ecosystem. E.g. Helm, operator patterns, metrics and monitoring, security and networking etc.
* Infrastructure as Code experience, particularly with Terraform
* Solid programming experience in at least one language (Python preferred, but Go, Rust, or similar languages are valuable)
* Proficient collaboration skills with ability to:
	+ Collaborate well with development teams as well as other internal stakeholders.
	+ Communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
	+ Steer architectural decisions and contribute to technical discussions

##### **Valuable additions**

* Familiarity with Amazon Web Services
* Familiarity with the ArgoCD and GitOps workflows
* Familiarity with the Bazel build system
* Familiarity with container networking interfaces
* Experience designing/architecting scalable software systems
* Experience with Nix
* Experience with continuous integration tools and pipelining.

#### **More about Zenseact**

 **Our software makes a difference.**  

Using AI-based technology to create the ultimate driver support, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Every year, around 1,4 million people die in traffic while approximately 50 million people get injured. Many get disabled as a result of their injury. We can do better.

**One purpose, one product.**  

We’re a software company dedicated to revolutionizing car safety. By designing the complete software stack for autonomous driving and advanced driver-assistance systems, we’re fighting to end car accidents and make roads safe for everyone. Zenseact was founded by Volvo Cars, and the teams are based in Gothenburg and Lund, Sweden, Munich in Germany and Shanghai, China. When we aim for zero accidents faster, we strive to speed up the transition to safe automation. This is essentially achieved by making cars updatable – like a computer or a phone. With regular software updates, a vehicle can be made safer long after its production. By accelerating improvement loops, shortening development cycles, and deploying high-capacity software quickly, we can make cars safer, and faster.

**Culture with people at heart**  

To achieve our mission of saving lives and ending traffic accidents we must go where nobody has before. It requires us to venture into the unknown, pioneering new technology and pushing the frontier of autonomous driving. While there’s no denying our determination and expertise, we must stand united to succeed. By fostering a culture of support and enablement – a place of psychological safety where all of us can thrive – everything else will follow. We call this a **people-at-heart culture.** This culture means caring. It means the company cares about me, and we care about one another. It means sharing, so we give each other energy and have fun together. Our culture is also about belonging. It’s important to feel at home and that we can be ourselves at work. Finally, a people-at-heart culture means well-being. So, we enjoy the flexibility needed to be and do our best – at work and in life.

*Zenseact works proactively to create a culture of diversity and inclusion, where individual differences are appreciated and respected. To drive innovation we see diversity as an asset, which means we value and respect differences in gender, race, ethnicity, religion or other belief, disability, sexual orientation or age, etc.*  

  

*Interviews are held continuously, so we highly recommend that you submit your application at your earliest convenience.*

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About us**


Founded in 2015, Instabox is a Sweden-based tech company with the mission to make online shopping easier. In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the merchant at heart.


We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for a Software Engineer with machine learning knowledge to help us govern our journey ahead!

**About the role**


At the Route Optimization team, you’ll play a crucial role in building, maintaining, and enhancing the models and services that drive our core operations. We follow an end-to-end approach: collecting and preprocessing data, developing and validating models, deploying these models, and integrating them into our routing engine. Your work will directly impact how Instabee optimizes its routes, empowering the business to make informed strategic decisions, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.

*To do this we’ll expect you to:*

* Build and maintain models and services and deploy them
* Take the lead on developing new features and refactoring existing code, ensuring high standards of code quality and efficiency
* Stay at the forefront of software development trends, experimenting with new approaches and technologies to continuously improve our systems
* Work closely with algorithm engineers, machine learning engineers, and the broader tech team to share ideas and support each other in achieving our goals
* Advocate for best coding practices, both within the team and across the organization, inspiring others to maintain high standards
  

*To succeed in this role you probably:*

* Love writing high-quality production-grade code
* Have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer or Machine Learning Engineer, working in a modern tech environment
* Experience in building and deploying machine learning models
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java. Experience with various databases is a plus
* Familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, Docker, and other DevOps tools
* You’ve led feature development, refactoring efforts, and know how to inspire those around you


If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!

 **What you’ll get**


We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!  

  

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:


Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.  

Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!  

Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town  

Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.  

Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.  

Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.  

Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.  

Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.  

 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care  

and love to your little one.  

 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!

  



Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*

  

#LI-HR1

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Since 2014, Acast has been creating the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, building the technology which connects podcast creators, advertisers and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 135,000 podcasts, 2,700 advertisers and c.1 billion quarterly listens.


Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen - across any podcasting app or other listening platform. The company operates worldwide and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Acast is listed on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market.

**About the role**

  

In just a few seconds, Acast’s Dynamic Ad Insertion platform dynamically sources, selects, and splices ads into uniquely personalised streams for millions of listens every day, all while optimising towards the best possible return for the creator, advertiser, and of course the listener themselves.


As the Engineering Manager for Ad Delivery, you’ll be working on Acast’s own ad server, integrations with third-party ad servers, and our rapidly evolving yield optimisation platform to make the most of every listen and campaign. To do this you’ll also be tapping into Acast’s audience indexing and contextual targeting capabilities, owning and managing our monetisation management tools, and providing core business data sources to teams around Acast to enable payouts, insights, and metrics.


Your responsibilities are to ensure sustainable successful delivery of your team’s products, through your own direct contribution, team leadership, and management of team processes and planning. Through a tight collaboration with your partner Product Manager, you will be the engine of progress towards the goal of matching as much monetisable inventory with the best possible ads in the most valuable manner possible.

 **What you´ll do**


You’ll directly manage a highly skilled and experienced team of software and data engineers, distributed across Europe. You’ll be responsible for their individual growth and performance on an ongoing basis, providing frequent feedback, solid development plans, and insightful reviews. You’ll work with your team every day, and sync with them individually every week, building a close relationship based on trust to help everyone do their best work.


You’ll elevate your team to take ownership and exercise autonomy judiciously in order to best deliver against the team’s objectives, but also be ready to step forward and lead directly when needed. You will organise the team’s work and staffing to match capacity against demand, ensuring its long-term health and effectiveness. You’ll think creatively when approaching ambitious goals across a wide range of product capabilities so that progress is made in a sustainable, lean manner, nurturing just enough process to do the job well.


Working as a member of the team, you will directly contribute to the development of the team’s tech stack, in whichever form best suits your skillset and needs of the day. Whether you’re writing code, testing features, handling operations, or supporting colleagues from around the business, we believe engineering leaders are most effective when they’re hands-on day-to-day. You’ll contribute to the design of systems and architectures, and work alongside other engineering leads and senior engineering staff to produce solutions spanning the entire Acast platform.


Stellar results require close, productive collaboration between people and teams, which you will take a front seat in facilitating. You’ll readily develop relationships across teams, knowing the best people to include at the right moment. You’ll foster an open and productive dialogue between your team and their stakeholders, inside and out, ensuring that we deliver the right thing, on time, on a stable and scalable foundation.

 **Who you are**

  

You will have a past where you’ve “done it all” - from building small features through to designing architectures, you’ll know what it takes to produce great software. You will have experience of developing and maintaining large back-end architectures designed for scale and high availability, and have actively supported operations both in- and out-of-hours. At heart you’ll still be an engineer excited by new tools and techniques, but have the experience to understand how and when to introduce them.


You may not have managed people directly before but you will have been a leader amongst your peers. You’re used to being the most senior or experienced engineer in the room most of the time, but know how to leave space for others and amplify their ideas. You’ll feel equally comfortable working with a junior engineer in their first role, or a staff engineer with decades under their belt. You’ll bring empathy, a healthy balance of critical and supportive engagement to the work of others, and a positive mindset to motivate those around you.


Communication will probably be your strongest skill, knowing how to bring people in with honesty, clarity, and accuracy - whether you’re explaining tech to non-technical senior leadership or debugging production software with engineers.


The role of Engineering Manager leans on a huge range of skills, applied in a diverse set of contexts. You will relish an opportunity to do new things but also act as the servant leader, readily taking on the work that is needed most, not just the most appealing. You will know how to grow yourself and others, and enjoy the variety of the role over time. You’ll improve the groups you work within by amplifying their strengths while filling the gaps. Most of all, you’ll want to do the best job you can, and help others do the same.

  

Plus points in experience include:  

Cloud architecture (particularly AWS), TypeScript, online ad industry standards (VAST, OpenRTB), back-end service development, high-volume API development, serverless batch processing, devops.

**Where you will be**


The team works remotely for the most part, with members based in a few European countries and a concentration in Stockholm where in-person collaboration is possible in our offices. The “core hours” for team collaboration are generally 1000-1600 CET.

 **Culture & DEI**

  

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.


Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.


We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.


We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

title: Project Manager
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Develop and oversee clear project roadmaps, timelines, and priorities.  

Coordinate resources and stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.  

Act as the primary point of contact for all project stakeholders, ensuring transparent communication with internal and external teams.  

Manage timelines and activities with external suppliers, acting as the single point of contact between vendors and internal departments.  

Identify risks, develop mitigation strategies, and handle challenges to ensure smooth project execution.  

Set up and lead cross-functional project teams, ensuring:  

Deliverables are met according to the defined plan.  

The right resources are allocated for execution.  

Team productivity through strong leadership and efficient ways of working.  

Foster a culture of continuous improvement, ensuring solutions evolve to meet future needs.  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Degree in IT, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in project management within telecom, network deployments, digital development, or a related field.
* Experience in large-scale deployment projects, managing complex timelines and shifting priorities.
* Strong skills in reporting project progress and documentation.
* A proactive and structured approach, with the ability to adapt to dynamic IT projects in industrial environments.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to engage and motivate cross-functional teams.

  

**Application deadline:** 14-02-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener! **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Brinner du för utveckling och letar efter en ny spännande och meningsfull utmaning? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom systemutveckling för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Du är erfaren inom systemutveckling och bekväm med både front- och backend, redo att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad. Vi letar efter dig som är nyfiken, engagerad och som trivs med att arbeta på varierande uppdrag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med några av dessa teknologier:
   

  

**Frontend**
* JavaScript/TypeScript: Gedigen kunskap inom modern JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Ramverk: Erfarenhet av ramverk som React, Vue eller Angular.
* HTML & CSS: Stark grund inom HTML5 och CSS3, gärna även erfarenhet av Bootstrap eller Tailwind.
* State Management: Kunskaper i bibliotek som Redux eller Vuex.


**Backend**
* Programmeringsspråk: Erfarenhet av språk som Node.js, Java, C#, Python eller Go.
* API-design: Skicklighet i att utveckla och designa RESTful API, gärna även GraphQL.
* Databaser: Kunskap i både relationsdatabaser (t.ex. PostgreSQL, MySQL) och NoSQL (t.ex. MongoDB, Redis).
* Säkerhet: Erfarenhet av säkerhetsprinciper och autentisering som OAuth, JWT eller SAML.


**DevOps och Infrastruktur**
* Molnplattformar: Erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* CI/CD: Kunskap om CI/CD med verktyg som Jenkins, GitLab CI eller GitHub Actions.
* Containrar: Erfarenhet av Docker och gärna även Kubernetes.
* Versionshantering: Flytande i Git och vana vid Git-baserade arbetsflöden.


**Övrigt**
* Testning: Kunskap i testautomatisering, både frontend och backend (t.ex. Jest, Mocha, JUnit, Selenium).
* Agilt arbete: Erfarenhet av Scrum eller Kanban.
* Kommunikation och samarbete: Förmåga att arbeta effektivt i team och bidra till kunskapsutbyte.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Manufacturing Konsult (hybrid)
description:
Att arbeta på COSMO CONSULT är inte som på andra ställen.
   

  

 Utforska vår COSMO-verse och låt dig inspireras av den positiva energin bland COSMOnautarna. Tillsammans skapar vi framtiden - for people, by people. Vi utvecklas tillsammans.
   

  

 Upplev genuin respekt i en miljö där du kan känna dig trygg, en plats full av passion och innovation.
   

  

 Anslut dig till vårt team och bli en del av en av världens ledande Microsoft-partners för verksamhetstransformation och digitalisering.
   

  

**Älska ditt jobb** 
 på nytt – skicka oss din ansökan som
   

  

 Manufacturing Konsult
   

  

 Om tjänsten:
   

  

* Som konsult inom vår Manufacturing vertikal blir din viktigaste uppgift att hjälpa våra kunder inom tillverkande industri att förbättra och utveckla sina affärsprocesser. Du kommer vara delaktig i projekt som rör både införande av nya affärssystem och löpande förbättringsarbete. Du skapar mervärde för kunden genom din förståelse för kundens verksamhet och förmåga att vägleda den till processförbättringar som möjliggörs med affärssystemet Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central och våra nischade tilläggsprodukter för tillverkande industri.
* Våra arbetsformer innebär att du ibland arbetar i ett större projektteam och ibland möter kunden själv. Viss del av arbetet görs på något av våra kontor och viss del av arbetet görs ute hos våra kunder. Detta innebär att tjänsten kan innebära en del resor beroende på kund och projekt. Möjligheten finns även att få delta i internationella projekt.
* Arbetet som konsult är otroligt spännande och varierande - och du kommer snabbt att se att det arbete du utför skapar resultat hos kunderna. Hos oss på COSMO CONSULT kommer du få möjligheter att arbeta tillsammans med flera av Sveriges mest erfarna och kompetenta BC-kollegor. För oss är teamwork en självklarhet, och vi hjälper varandra att kontinuerligt förbättras.


 Du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

 Relevant utbildning från högskola eller universitet och flera års kvalificerad erfarenhet från tillverkande industri, antingen som ledare i linjebefattning eller som affärssystemkonsult.
   

  

 Flera års erfarenhet från implementationer av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central/Dynamics NAV eller annat relevant affärssystem, som konsult alternativt som superanvändare på kundsidan. Ett plus om du har erfarenhet av att jobba i projekt med Azure DevOps. Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är en förtroendeingivande representant för COSMO CONSULT. Du har ett starkt kundfokus och slutför alltid de uppdrag som du påbörjat. Det är även viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och kan driva din personlig utveckling mot uppsatta mål, och så klart finns vi alltid där som stöd. För att passa in i vårt team tror vi att du trivs med att arbeta som en del i en projektgrupp likväl som att utföra uppdrag på egen hand. Som lagspelare har du en stark vilja att dela med dig av din kunskap till andra samt visar andra respekt och omtanke. Utifrån senioritetsnivå bidrar du även till egen beläggning samt deltar i varierande omfattning i marknadsbearbetning hos befintliga och nya kunder.
   

  

 Lika lika och unika.
   

  

 Det är det som skiljer oss åt:
   

  

* Hos oss är alla en del av teamet - din röst behövs, även när det gäller vår egen företagsutveckling.
* Det är viktigt för oss att du känner dig uppskattad och sedd.
* Platsoberoende och flexibelt arbete är en självklarhet för oss. I rollen ingår det att kontinuerligt besöka något av våra kontor runt om i Sverige: Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Umeå.
* Internationellt samarbete är en del av vår vardag - upptäck andra kulturer och nya miljöer.
* En säker och positiv arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet.
* Förändring är en del av oss, och det är därför vi aldrig står stilla utan alltid utvecklas.
* Det ligger oss varmt om hjärtat att tillsammans med dig forma din vidareutveckling.
* Hos oss kan du följa din personliga karriärsväg.
* Vi tar vårt del av ansvaret för människor och miljö på allvar.


 Do you want to become part of the team?
   

  

 Apply directly online with your informative application documents and your earliest possible start date.
   

  

 Do you want more #insideCOSMO?

title: Engineering Managers to IAR in Uppsala
company: アイエーアール・システムズ株式会社
description:
At IAR, our Engineering organization has experienced significant growth in recent years, and we’re now embarking on the next chapter of our journey. By uniting our Engineering department in Sweden and Cambridge into a single cohesive department, we aim to create an even stronger and more dynamic organization.



This integration allows us to build teams that are strategically organized to tackle the challenges of tomorrow and equipped with the skills needed to drive innovation and deliver exceptional results. As part of this transformation, we are forming additional specialized teams, creating exciting opportunities for new Engineering Managers to join us and lead these teams to success.

  

**Country:** Sweden  

**Site:** Uppsala  

**Department:** Engineering  

**Report to:** Peter Johansson, VP of Engineering  

**Job type:** Permanent, Fulltime, Hybrid, Open to flexibility  

  

**About the Role**

  


As an Engineering Manager, you will drive the organization’s goals by empowering and engaging with the technical experts in your team, while supporting the success of a group of experienced software engineers by clearly communicating expectations, initiatives, and objectives.



You will contribute to the evolution of solutions targeting the embedded domain as part of the Engineering division. We are striving for better ways of working as well as advancing the solutions engineering model. You will accomplish this by collaborating with stakeholders across various domains, both technical and organizational. Your responsibilities will include budget preparations, full employment journey, individual coaching, and your teams’ delivery of value to stakeholders while working towards company goals.



In Engineering we work together with development of products that our customers use in their development of embedded systems. We provide customers with IDEs, debuggers, probes for connectivity to hardware devices for programming and debugging, compiles, linkers, static analysis tools, tools for state machine modelling, and plugins for VS Code and Eclipse. Additionally, we provide security solutions to protect our customers’ IP through the lifecycle of their products.

  


**Openings in three Engineering Teams**



The restructuring of our engineering department now creates openings for **three** new Engineering Managers to join IAR! The qualifications we are looking for are similar for all three roles, as the overall responsibility of an Engineering Manager is consistent regardless of which team you lead. The size of each team is in between 10-15 people, and all three managers will work mainly from our Uppsala office.



What differs is the product area you will be part of, as each team focuses on its own specific domain. Together with Product owners, you will be involved in leading the work within your team The technical and strategic focus areas will vary depending on the team you belong to. No matter which team you are part of, there will be a lot of cooperation together with other Engineering Managers as well. Learn more about the teams below!

  


**Debugger devices, Probes and LMS team**



This team focuses on developing and maintaining debugger technology on desktop for customer developers as well as for our probes, and adding support for hardware devices. Hardware device support in the debugger is enabling customers to connect to the right hardware in a seamless and efficient manner. This also includes work with VHDL design and software that runs on the hardware probes as well as on a PC. In addition to this, the team is responsible for our license management system, which is a product encompassing both Windows and Linux-based solutions, as well as a cloud service. The team primarily works with C and C++ in both embedded and PC environments, using modern technologies to create high-quality and scalable solutions.

  


**Product Governance team**



This international team, with members in both Sweden and Cambridge, is responsible for some of IAR's strategic functions within system architecture, product ownership, project management and product documentation. The team plays a central role in supporting the entire Engineering organization by delivering system level expertise and need to interact across, and beyond, Engineering. When applying for this role, your experience from project management, or work as a product owner in addition to leading people is more important than the technical aspects of embedded components and PC software development (see success factors for the roles below). The team works on developing and maintaining the system architecture for our solutions, while also being responsible for product documentation and system level leadership for Engineering to deliver on their commitments. In the team’s daily work they come across products and solutions developed using technologies such as C, C++, Python, Java, C#, assembler, VHDL, MFC, and Qt.

  


**IDE team**



Our IDE team develops and maintains IAR's Embedded Workbench, plugins for VSCode, and Eclipse. These are used by our customers to edit, build, debug, and analyze embedded applications. The team focuses on creating a user-friendly and efficient platform with features such as code editing, language support, and source-code-project management. The IDE team is also responsible for our VisualState product.



The work is carried out using technologies such as C++, Qt, MFC (Microsoft Foundation Classes), Java and Typescript. Their goal is to deliver a stable and smooth user experience that facilitates the development process for our customers.

  


**Qualifications**  



Regardless of what team you lead, we are looking for a great communicator! Communication is key to success and will be your most important tool, both oral and written. You will have a lot of interaction with your team, stakeholders, customers, and partners. You should, therefore, be someone with a natural commitment to building relationships. With a positive attitude and the ability to inspire confidence, you will enable an innovative and creative atmosphere.



You will need to understand the big picture while having enough understanding of the technical details to structure your work and support the prioritization of the team.



You have previous managerial experience and a background in the software development industry. You are comfortable in your leadership role and can align a team towards common goals, working together to find solutions. Your understanding of how to work efficiently in agile processes with software development will support you in leading the experienced engineers in your team. Experience in advocating and advancing modern software engineering practices is a prerequisite for the role.

  


**To succeed in this role, we see that you have:**


* Proven leadership experience with personnel responsibility
* A general understanding of software development utilizing languages such as C and C++ (to understand what your team is doing)
* Experience from change management
* An understanding of the pros and cons with different software development methodologies
* A positive, enthusiastic, and pragmatic approach
* A desire to deliver on common goals and cooperate with other departments within Engineering to achieve this
* Full professional proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish

  


**We see it as a plus if you also have**


* An understanding of engineering development tools, such as Jira
* Experience integrating with CI frameworks e.g., Jenkins, TeamCity
* An understanding of security and cryptography

  


**What we offer**



IAR is a multi-cultural and global business in a fast-growing industry, an organization where every co-worker's individual role is very important in the big picture. We welcome new ideas and take pride in our achievements. We offer you the opportunity to work in a curious, knowledge-sharing environment with a strong team spirit, where we will support you to grow both professionally and as an individual. We are problem-solvers and take on new challenges with excitement and energy. You will be part of a curious and solution-oriented Engineering Management Team comprising eight Engineering managers. Therefore, we place great emphasis on your personal qualities and their alignment with our values.

  

**About IAR**  

IAR Systems, founded in 1983 in Uppsala, Sweden, and provides world leading software and services that accelerate developer productivity in embedded development and embedded security, enabling companies worldwide to create and secure the products of today and the innovations of tomorrow.  

  

After 40 years in business, our home and heart is still in Uppsala where we started, but we now serve and support our customers globally from 13 offices located in almost every time zone and in key regions. Together, we strive to deliver a secure and intelligent embedded development experience.

  


**Interesting links**  

  

About IAR: Click here



Our customers: Click here

title: Seinor SAP BW Consultant
description:
Avigna is hiring Seinor SAP BW Consultant


Our SAP Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for Seinor SAP BW Consultant to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule. If you want to grow and build the foundation on the S4 Hana platform working across multiple customers, look no further.


In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

**Experience:** 10+ years

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden

**Mode of work:** Onsite  

**Required skills:**

* Experience in at least three full life cycle implementations on SAP BW or BW/4HANA with HANA Modeling.
* Consultant should have prior experience working on SAP BW projects with European clients
* Hands-on experience with SAP Analytics Cloud and Power BI for frontend analytics
* Extensive experience in SAP BW Retail scenarios which includes General Ledger, Billing (SAP ECC), Inventory Management (SAP ECC),POS-data (SAP CAR),Warehouse transactions (SAP EWM)
* Experience with CDS Views-based data modeling, data integration, and provisioning to/from SAP BW.
* Expertise in Data Volume Management, preferably in projects handling large datasets.
* Proficiency in SAP Datasphere.
* Strong team player in an Agile environment, capable of handling diverse tasks to meet sprint commitments.
* Ability to facilitate Scrum events and actively drive development while coaching and guiding the team in Scrum practices and values.
* Sound Knowledge on Integrated Planning/BPC.

**Nice-to-have:**

 **Benefits:**  

Competitive Salary  

Pension, Health, Occupation injury, and sick insurances  

Opportunity to latest courses and certification  

Other company benefits

title: Information Security Manager
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

 **Information** **Security Manager**

As the Information Security Manager you will oversee the implementation of security requirements and capabilities across Stegra’s digital and operational technology (OT) environments. This includes creating directives, performing threat modeling and risk assessments, defining architectural guidelines, and supporting mitigation efforts. You will also be responsible for building internal security competence through training and leadership, ensuring our teams have the skills needed to maintain robust security measures. In this role, you will work cross-functionally, collaborating with diverse teams across the organization.

 **Key Responsibilities:**  

  



**Leadership & Strategy**


* Align the organization’s information security strategy with business goals and evolving risks.
* Lead efforts to secure digital and OT environments, supporting transformation initiatives.
* Provide guidance to production and manufacturing teams on information and cyber-related matters.

 **Policy Development & Compliance**


* Develop, update, and enforce security policies, directives, and requirements.
* Ensure compliance with frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST, and GDPR.
* Conduct assessments to verify adherence to policies and regulatory requirements.
* Maintain internal control over financial processes in line with auditing standards.

 **Risk Management**


* Perform regular risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and threats.
* Implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks.
* Develop and maintain risk management framework

 **Team Leadership & Collaboration**


* Mentor and upskill development and operational teams to build internal security competence.
* Foster security awareness and best practices across the organization.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with finance, HR, legal, and digital teams to embed security into all operations.

 **Operations & Reporting**


* Oversee security tools and systems, ensuring readiness to protect, detect and respond to threats.
* Oversee managed services, e.g. SOC operations
* Develop dashboards and reporting practices to track key metrics, incident mitigations, and security maturity levels

**Qualifications:**


We’re looking for someone with:


* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, cybersecurity, or a related field; a master’s degree is a plus.
* Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH are meritorious.
* Proficiency in security tools, technologies, and frameworks, including cloud, OT, network, and application security.
* Experience with security automation and architectural guidelines.
* Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze complex systems, identify security risks, and develop effective solutions.
* Proven leadership experience with a track record of managing teams or/and projects successfully.

Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, ensuring alignment and integration of security measures across the organization.  

* 

  

**Personal qualities**


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative and drives security efforts that create real impact. A practical, solution-oriented mindset is essential, as you’ll navigate complex systems and find effective ways to secure both digital and operational environments. Curiosity and a proactive approach will help you stay ahead of emerging security challenges. With a forward-looking perspective, you’ll play a key role in driving change and strengthening the security culture across the organization.

 **Location:** Stockholm, Sweden  

  



Applications will be reviewed on the 24th of February, and first after that you can expect an update from us.

title: RAN Solution Engineer
description:
**We are now looking for a RAN Solution Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm! In this role you will mostly be working with customers in Stockholm, but some traveling to customers in other Nordic countries will be expected. Are you our next RAN solution expert?** ***Get the future you want and apply today!***

**Responsibilities**  

* **Lead the design and implementation of RAN networks, including LTE, and 5G NR (New Radio) technologies.**
* **Oversee the deployment and integration of RAN nodes (e.g., eNBs, gNBs, RRU, BBU, Small Cells) into existing networks. Ensure proper network functionality and performance or worked in past for these kinds of roles.**
* **Design, validate, and implement 5G architecture and next-gen technologies (e.g., Carrier Aggregation (CA), MIMO, Massive MIMO, beamforming, Network Slicing).**
* **Provide input into the strategic planning of future RAN technologies. Lead initiatives in network automation, cloud-native RAN, and virtualized RAN (vRAN),**
* **Support pre-sales team and Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users**
* **Ability to deliver presentations and demonstrations confidently to technical and non-technical audiences**
* **Work closely with core network engineers, backhaul engineers, and service providers to ensure seamless integration of RAN with the broader network.**
* **Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements and standards for network deployment and operations.**
* **Undertake technical ownership and responsibility for small to medium sized opportunities and accounts**
* **Drive the pre-sales discussions, presentations and customer meetings**
**Required Skills & Qualifications**  

* **Min 10 years in RAN design, optimization, and troubleshooting, with at least 5 years of experience in 5G/LTE technologies.**
* **Strong understanding of 4G LTE, 5G NR, including radio interface protocols, PHY/MAC layers, and eNB/gNB configurations.**
* **Expertise in 5G NR technology, 5G core network integration, network slicing, and related 5G innovations (e.g., massive MIMO, beamforming, Carrier Aggregation).**

title: Senior Account Executive
description:
Overview:

We are looking for our new **Senior** **Account Executive** with a track record of surpassing quotas, and if you have had the success of selling complex integration software solutions, you're the ideal candidate we're looking for! Your expertise and dedication will play a pivotal role in driving innovation, empowering our clients, and shaping the future of the digital landscape. As an integral part of our team, you'll be at the forefront of selling our industry leading MFT, API, and Cloud SaaS products, enabling businesses to revolutionize their operations. If this describes you, then join Axway’s sales team and help facilitate your growth as well as ours in one of the fastest growing market segments.  

The new Senior Account Executive will be responsible for new logo acquisition and growing relationships with existing partners and customers for the Nordics Region (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, native language required).
Responsibilities:* **Revenue achievement**
* Setting and implementing
	+ Strategic plans to address named customer needs
	+ Tactical sales plans to work on key client projects and to close deals on time
	+ Forecast
* Building full Axway customers approach including Sales, Services, Presales and Support
* Achieving quarterly and yearly License, Cloud and Services revenue
* Working to sign new logos and to generate new opportunities through the development of a solid partner’s ecosystem and marketing initiatives
* **Customer Relationships**
* Become a trusted adviser of key execs in the account
* Bring a vision into the accounts, to meet exec and to contribute to customer digital transformation
* Leverage insight of business issues and industry trends
* Build network of stakeholders at all level and establish strong & sustainable relationships with key executives and decision makers in strategic accounts
* Develop a strong customer satisfaction culture
* Qualify the landscape of partners within the account, software vendors and other technology vendors
* **Partner Relationships**
* Create and maintain productive relationships with key partners in territory
* Collaborate with partners to create and review joint pipeline of opportunities, and establish a success plan on deals

Qualifications:
* Strong, dynamic, determined and customer-oriented personality with power of endurance
* 100% Hunter, always willing to extend his footprint and to grow the revenue
* Strong general business culture (industry trends, enterprise organization, dept role...)
* Passionate about developing long-term & high-level customer & partner relations
* Expert to achieve revenue goals with a rigor based on measurable and ambition indicators (Excellent in Execution)
* Ability to work as a sales leader to motivate and engage Axway presales, services, marketing, partner and support teams in customers projects.
* Ability to work with a large ecosystem of partners, ISV...
* Enjoy working in trust and autonomy with a high-level sense of ethic & responsibility.
* Capacity for teamwork and to inspire positive behaviors
* Excellent communication skills (oral & written)
* Degree level or equivalent: Master in business administration, Engineering, Business Informatics or similar
* 5+ years’ experience in B2B Software Solution Sales to Large Enterprises is mandatory
* Experiences in on premise & Cloud/SaaS based software solutions sales, ERP and business application and/or Middleware sector
* Good English language skills

**Company Overview**
At Axway, we’re more than a company—we’re a pioneer. For 25 years, we’ve been empowering organizations to achieve digital transformation and unlock innovation. With a presence in 100 countries, 11,000+ customers, and a global team of over 1,400+ passionate professionals, Axway is driving the future of enterprise integration.  

We’re on a mission to a **be the leader** in our space, empowering our customers with **secure, mission-critical software** to manage and deliver impactful business outcomes from all their **digital business interactions**. **Why Axway?**
We believe in the power of togetherness. When you’re part of Axway, you’re part of a culturally rich and globally connected community that thrives on exchanging ideas and tackling challenges head-on. Whether working remotely or onsite, you’ll find camaraderie, collaboration, and the support of leadership to inspire you daily.  

Here, you’ll grow, innovate, and succeed because we’re better together. Each step forward in your personal journey is one we take as a team. Join us, and let’s accomplish extraordinary things together.  

Axway is a proud member of 74Software. Learn more about how Axway is transforming the future: https://www.axway.com/en. **Ready to shape the future? Let’s get started—because at Axway, together, we can. Together, we will.**
